texts.es: Merli es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Soncco, tiene la edad de 26 años, no tiene hijos, es soltera, se dedica a la venta de ropa de mujeres, ahora tiene su tiendita, esta orgullosa porque esta saliendo adelante sola, gracias a Finca se esta educando sola en un Instituto donde estudia la carrera de contabilidad, también dice que mejoro su negocio por los ahorros y préstamo que ha recibido con facilidad, gracias a ello se ha comprado sus exhibidores y vitrinas, aprendió la puntualidad, responsabilidad y a salir adelante sola, el préstamo que solicita ahora lo invertirá en compra de ropas, peluches, carteras y accesorios por temporada de día de san Valentín.
texts.en:
Merli is a member of the Ccori Soncco communal bank.  She is 26, single, and does not have children.

She sells women’s clothes.  She now has a store, and she is proud because she is getting ahead by herself.  Thanks to Finca she is getting an education at an Institute where she is studying the career of accounting.  She also says that her business improved with savings and with the loan that she easily received.

Thanks to this she has purchased her cabinets and display cases.  She learned to be punctual, responsible, and to get ahead by herself.

She will use the loan she is now requesting to buy clothes, stuffed animals, wallets, and accessories for Valentine’s Day.

loans.use: to buy clothes, stuffed animals, wallets, and accessories.

loans.name: Luz Y Esperanza 2 Group

texts.en:
Luz is the coordinator of the Luz y Esperanza 2 Group (Light and Hope). She lives in Santiago, the second largest city -- in population and in economy -- in the county. 

Luz has a cafeteria and also sells miscellaneous items. She began her business about three years ago, with her first Esperanza international loan. She is asking for her sixth loan with Esperanza in order to buy goods for her cafeteria, where she sells sandwiches, juices, hot dogs and many snacks. 

With this investment she plans to expand her business and add more products such as blouses, pants, shirts and other items to her miscellaneous sales. Her business profits will be used to reinvest and save. 

Luz lives with her long-term partner and their three children, all of whom still live at home. Their simple home is in a slum area of this big city. The most important goal that Luz has right now is to build her own house. Luz enjoys dancing and watching television. One of her dreams is to buy a plot of land and build her house. 

Luz and her group are grateful for the great help they have been given by Kiva lenders because each step brings them closer to achieving their dreams and goals.

loans.use: to buy bread, ham, cheese, fruits, snacks, etc.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un joven padre de familia de 1 hijo, él tiene 31 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa en caserío rural en el que se dedican a la agricultora y ganadería exclusivamente, el caserío donde ellos viven lleva por nombre CP-3 del distrito de Tambogrande. A unos escasos minutos de la provincia de Piura. Por ser caseríos que están en vía se desarrollo es que por ahora solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica 

Manuel es hombre que la gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado al campo ya sea por la agricultura o la ganadería, negocios los cuales han sido el sustento de sus padres y de él mismo cuando era joven, ahora ya con familia pone en practica lo que de pequeño aprendió, pues el se dedica a la agricultura mientras que su esposa se dedica a la crianza, engorde y posterior venta de animales de corral, como pavos, patos, ovinos y entre otros. Ambos se han proyectado  a incrementar ambos ingresos debido a que desean mejorar sus condiciones de vida para ellos y para su hijo darle una buena alimentación y educación correspondiente.

Manuel ha decidido solicitar un crédito de 1500 Nuevos Soles en Edpyme Alternativa, debido a que cuenta con plantación de Limón por lo que necesita comprar fertilizantes para mejorar su producción, y a la vez comprar alimentos balanceados para los animales que cría su esposa.
texts.en:
Manuel is a young father of one child.  He is 31 years old and lives together with his wife in a small rural village whose residents work exclusively in farming and livestock raising.  Their village is called CP-3 and it is located in Tambogrande district, a few minutes from Piura province.  As their village is still developing, right now the only basic service they receive is electricity.

Manuel is a man who has spent most of his life working in the countryside, whether farming or raising livestock.  These are businesses that supported his parents and himself when he was young.  Now that he has his own family, he puts into practice what he learned as a boy.  Manuel farms and his wife raises, fattens and sells farmyard animals such as turkeys, ducks, sheep, etc.  They both plan to increase their income because they would like to improve their living conditions both for themselves and their son.  They would like to provide their son with good food and a good education.

Manuel has decided to request a loan for 1,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  He has a lemon orchard and needs to buy fertilizers so that he can improve his production.  He will also buy nutritionally-balanced feed for the animals that his wife raises.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and nutritionally-balanced feed

loans.name: Renovacion Las Aguilas 1 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Nieve is one of the members of the Renovacion las Aguilas 1 and 4 Group (Las Aguilas renovation), named in honor of the baseball team in their city. The group includes 10 micro-business people who sell clothes, natural products, shoes, food, etc. 

Nieve's family includes herself and her four children, only one of whom lives with her. She lives in Santiago, the second largest city in the country. The town's economy depends on agriculture, cattle raising and tobacco growing, among others. The town also has a large Dominican and Haitian immigrant population who live with very limited resources. 

Nieve is very excited to receive her seventh loan with Esperanza Internacional after having duly paid her previous loan and taken steps to grow her business. She has had her business for about five years. She started it when she took her first loan. 

Nieve plans to invest her new loan in her business. She sells new clothes and miscellaneous products, and she will use this loan to buy clothes such as pants, shirts and underwear as well as shoes and cosmetics. She will use her business profits to expand her business and also to save to rebuild her house.

She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Banaz's Group

texts.en:
Banaz is a married Iraqi woman with three children. She is 30 years old. Since she learned to sew at a young age, she has 12 years of experience behind the machine. 

In the past, Banaz – along with her group members – took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, which allowed her to buy a new sewing machine.

Banaz is now taking a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $1200 to improve her working area and to buy better-quality fabric and materials. This will enable her to provide a wider selection and better-quality product for her customers. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" to clients unable to qualify for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to improve her working area and to buy better-quality fabric and materials.

loans.name: Shan's Group

texts.en:
Shan is 44 years old, married, and has three children. For the past five years she has been contributing to the family’s income by working from home, using her old sewing machine. Hoping for an improved future for her children, she is happy to work from home and is always looking for ways to provide new and better services to her customers.   

Shan is requesting a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq for $1,500, which she will use  to buy a new sewing machine, fabric, and raw materials so that she can provide her customers with a wider selection and better quality product. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers group loans for clients unable to provide a guarantor, thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, fabric, and raw materials.

loans.name: Pashaw's Group

texts.en:
Pashaw is a married, young mother. She is 21 years old, and like many Iraqi women, has learned to sew at a young age. She has 4 years experience sewing and tailoring, and she is working from her home to help support her family, generating income from the sewing and tailoring orders.

A shy, traditional woman, Pashaw is using her skills to help create a respectable social status for her child.

Pashaw took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 1,600 USD to improve her working area and to be able to buy better quality fabric and materials. 

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her working area and to be able to buy better quality fabric and materials

loans.name: Naska's Group

texts.en:
Naska is a 31-year-old woman from Iraq. She is married and a mother of one child. She has 6 years sewing and tailoring experience. In the past, Naska – along with her group members – took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq, which allowed her to buy a new over machine.

Naska now took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of 600 USD to improve her working area.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "Group loans" for clients unable to provide a guarantor - thereby unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of 3 to 5 clients and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support for Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her working area

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is from Matco Panalsalan, Plaridel Misamis Occidental. She is 57 years old. Aida is married and has two adult-age children. 

To make a living, Aida owns and operates a tailoring business. She tailors a variety of clothes in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

Aida is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a secondhand tailoring machine. In 2007, Aida joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a tailoring machine

loans.name: Estilito

texts.en:
Estilito is married with 1 child. Estilito is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines.

To earn a living, Estilito is operating a service-based business, providing transportation services to local community members. He has been doing this for 6 years and every month he earns 3,000 PHP from this work. He has requested a loan of 8,100 PHP to repair an existing vehicle for better service.

Estilito has been a member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Estilito hopes to gain double income to sustain the family's daily needs.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Voeurn

texts.en: Voeurn, 66, is widowed and resides with her daughter in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been selling sweet cakes for over 10 years and is successful in her career. She earns approximately 3 USD per day. Her daughter is a garment worker and earns approximately 4 USD per day. Since the factory is far away from home, Voeurn is requesting a loan of 600 USD to purchase a motorbike for her daughter for commuting to work. By doing so, her daughter would be able to save some money on her transportation expense to support the family. In the future, Voeurn would like to expand her business, and rebuild her present house to be much stronger and to provide a comfortable living condition.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her daughter for commuting to work

loans.name: Thavy

texts.en:
Thavy is 29 years old, married,  and has two children.  She resides in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She and her husband have been involved in growing rice for over 10 years and are successful in their career. Additionally, her husband runs a motor taxi to generate additional income to support the family.

 In order to improve her husband’s business, Tavy is requesting a loan for $400 to purchase a new motorbike for her husband to run his transportation service. By doing so, her husband would generate more profits because a new motorbike would attract more customers. 

In the future, Thavy would like to run a grocery store at home and support her children to study until they earn a bachelor's degree. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it bigger and stronger to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to run his transportation service

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 2 hijos, él tiene 68 años de edad y vive junto a su esposa en caserío rural en el que se dedican a la agricultora y ganadería exclusivamente, el caserío donde ellos viven lleva por nombre “Miraflores Bajo Lote 15” del distrito de Tambogrande. A unos escasos minutos de la provincia de Piura. Por ser caseríos que están en vía se desarrollo es que por ahora solo cuentan con el servicio de energía eléctrica 

Juan es hombre que la gran parte de su vida se ha dedicado al campo ya sea por la agricultura o la ganadería, negocios los cuales han sido el sustento de sus padres y de él mismo cuando era joven, ahora ya con familia pone en practica lo que de pequeño aprendió, pues su negocio principal es dedicarse a la compra de animales como ovinos, caprinos, y aves de corral  entre otros. Adicionalmente se dedica a la agricultura para lo que cuenta con 1 has de terreno agrícola donde ha sembrado maíz y arroz. Los dos se han proyectado  a incrementar ambos ingresos debido a que desean mejorar sus condiciones de vida para ellos y para sus hijos y darles una buena alimentación y educación correspondiente.

Juan ha decidido solicitar un crédito de 1200 Nuevos Soles en Edpyme Alternativa, debido a que los productos sembrados actualmente necesitan ser abonados por  lo que necesita comprar fertilizantes para mejorar su producción, y a la vez comprar alimentos balanceados para los animales que cría su esposa.
texts.en:
Juan is a father of a family of two sons. He is 68 years old and lives together with his wife in a rural home where they work in agriculture and livestock exclusively. The home where they live is called "Miraflores Bajo Lote 15" in the Tambogrande district. It is a few short minutes from the province of Piura. Because they are country homes in a developing area, for now they only have electricity.

Juan is a man who, for the better part of his life, has worked in the country whether it be in agriculture or livestock, businesses that have been the livelihood of his parents and how he, too, earned a living when he was young. Now that he has a family he is putting into practice that which he learned when he was little. His main business is buying animals such as sheep, goats, and poultry, among others. Additionally he works in agriculture, for which he depends on one plot of farmland where he has sown corn and rice. The two of them have planned to grow both incomes because they want to improve their living conditions for themselves and for their sons and feed them well and give them the education they deserve.

Juan has decided to request a loan of 1200 Nuevos Soles through Edpyme Alternativa, since the products he has currently sown need to be fertilized. So he needs to buy fertilizer to improve his production, and at the same time he needs to buy balanced feed for the animals his wife is raising.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed and fertilizers.

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah sells clothes and some other goods. She is requesting a loan of 500 JD to purchase  more goods and clothes for business purposes.

Najah is looking to increase her capital by increasing her sales volume with an aspiration of purchasing a car for the family use. She is also looking to have her children finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase more goods and clothes for business purposes

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Edwin, a 48-year-old married father of six, lives in Segatic Daku, Misamis Occidental, Philippines, where his corn production is located. He started this work six years ago, earning a monthly income of PHP 8,000 which he divides equally amongst his family.

Edwin, who joined GDMPC to access financial services offered by the cooperative, has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. He hopes to plant sooner so as not to waste time, and plans to expand his business array.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: El señor Ruben, esta muy contento por el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic, ya que con los financimientos obtenidos a logrado sus propositos, esta vez necesita el prestamo para la compra de zinc,ya que en tiempos de lluvia el agua se pasa en toda casa y esto es muy incomodo para la familia ya que tienen que estar pasando de un lado a otro las cosas que tienen en el hogar para que no se deterioren .El desde hace varios años labora en un centro de educacion y el sueldo no le ajusta para comprar de una sola vez el zinc, perlines , golosos , entre otras herramientas que se utilizan para poder poner el zinc de una sola vez .
texts.en: Ruben is very happy to have the support that Afodenic provides him, since he has achieved his goals with the financing he has obtained. This time he needs a loan to buy zinc, since the water gets all over the house in the rainy season and this is very uncomfortable for his family. They have to move their household things from one side to the other so they don't get damaged. He has been working in an education center for several years and his salary doesn't allow him to buy all at once the zinc, perlins, bolts, and other tools that are used to put up the zinc all at once.

loans.use: to buy zinc.

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en:
Angelita, a 49-year-old married mother of two children, lives in the Philippines where she raises pigs for sale to earn a living. In this business for 20 years, she earns a monthly income of PHP 2,500.00 and is now requesting a loan of PHP 5,000.00 to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

A member of GDMPC since 2010, Angelita hopes to enable her children to finish their education.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.

loans.name: 04.12.12 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
For the past year Mrs. Thảo, a 45-year-old married mother of three children, has operated a food stall/restaurant selling pork pies and fermented pork rolls in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. The group leader of the 12-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of five members, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business.

Last year Thảo received and repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Her main business hardship is a lack of capital, so she is requesting a new loan to purchase more ingredients to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell. With her business profit, Thảo hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase pork to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls.

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es:
Mauricia tiene 40 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Huayllabamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive en el asentamiento urbano de Cotowincho del distrito de Urubamba. Mauricia se dedica a la venta de verduras en uno de los mercados populares de la ciudad de Urubamba. ella vende sus productos los días lunes, miércoles y domingo, ella también se dedica  a la  venta de bebidas alcohólicas pues tiene un pequeño bar. Mauricia requiere el préstamo para comprar verduras y cerveza. 

El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.

El departamento del Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Mauricia is 40 years old and lives in a common-law marriage from which she has four children.  She was born in the city of Huayllabamba in Urubamba province in the department of Cusco, and she lives in the urban settlement of Cotowincho in Urubamba district.  Maruricia works selling vegetables at one of the popular markets in the city of Urubamba.  She sells her products on Mondays, Wednesdays and Sundays.  She also works selling alcoholic beverages as she has a small bar.  Mauricia is requesting the loan to purchase vegetables and beer.

The "Munay Tika" communal bank is made up of responsible and hard-working people who are moving their families ahead in life.  The majority of the members live in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cuscco, and this is where they undertake their work activities.

The department of Cusco is known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables and beer.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en:
Horn is 27 years old,  married,  and has two children who attend school.  He resides in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. He has been running a business of renting sound equipment (speakers, mixer, and generator) for over two years, earning approximately $4 per day. His wife has been working in a rubber plantation for over three years. 

Horn is requesting a loan for $700, which he will use to purchase a walking tractor and a trailer for carrying his sound equipments to rent in the local community. In the future, he would like to purchase a truck for carrying his sound equipment to transport to a far site. Moreover, he hopes to rebuild his present house to be much stronger and to provide better living conditions for his family. He also hopes to support his children to study until they earn a bachelor's degree.

loans.use: to purchase a walking tractor and a trailer.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en:
Amarjargal is 34 years old, married, and has three children, one of whom attends school.  He lives in Western Mongolia. His wife is a door-keeper. He was a herder and in 2010, he moved to the province and started a taxi service. To run the business, he sold his livestock and bought an Excel van. The business is doing very well. 

Amarjargal is requesting a loan for 1,500,000 MNT, which he will use to buy a new van to keep his business successful. Amarjargal is a bright man who would like to expand his business by getting a big van with more seats and more space inside so that he can improve his livelihood and save for his family.

loans.use: to purchase a new van.

loans.name: Biviana

texts.es:
Biviana tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene cuatro hijos de la cuales tiene dos hijos independientes y dos todavía depende de ella, ella nació en la ciudad de Mararuna de la provincia de La Convención  del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en la hermosa ciudad de Urubamba. Biviana tiene varias actividades económicas como por ejemplo venta de verduras y venta de comestibles, ella tiene una pequeña tienda donde expende sus productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar y otras cosas mas. Biviana requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, tarros de leche y gaseosas.  

El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.

El departamento del Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Biviana is 50 years old, married, and the fruit of this relationship is 4 children, 2 of whom are independent and 2 still dependent on her.  Biviana was born in the city of Mararuna, province of La Convencion, department of Cusco, but presently she lives in the beautiful city of Urubamba. Biviana has a variety of economic activities; for example, selling vegetables and groceries. She has a small store where products of primary necessity are sold, including rice, sugar, and other such items. Biviana needs a loan to buy merchandise such as sacks of rice and sugar, bottles of milk, and soft drinks.

The “Munay Tika” communal bank is composed of responsible and hard-working people who are advancing their families. The majority of members live in the province of Urubamba, department of Cusco, where they pursue their economic activities.

Cusco department is famous as a tourist and commercial zone where the traditional Inti Raymi festival is held, and as home to one of the seven marvels of the world, “Machupicchu.”

loans.use: buy merchandise such as rice, sacks of sugar, bottles of milk, and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: La señora Maria, es habitante del municpio de Ticuantepe, junto a su familia, los planes hacia su hogar es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida, ya que con el prestamo anterior logro cerrar un cuarto que ahora sus hijos gozan y se siente muy sastifecha, la mayor dificultad que enfrento en este ciclo fue la operación de su pequeño hijo, fue operado de apendicite y esta se logro reventar lo cual provoco serios problemas de salud para su hijo y estuvo hospitalizado por mas de quince dias , esto no le permitio vender  y con solo el sueldo del esposo no podian cubrir todos los gastos del hogar y tres de las cuotas no las dio a tiempo . Esta vez quiere el prestamo para la compra de piedra , arena , hierro , piedrin , etc .
texts.en:
Señora Maria lives in the town of Ticuantepe with her family.  He plans for her household are to be able to improve her living conditions, as with her previous loan she was able to complete a room that her children now enjoy and she feels great satisfaction.  

The biggest difficulty that she has faced in this cycle was her young son's operation: he was operated on for appendicitis.  His appendix burst which caused some serious health problems for her son, and he was hospitalized for more than two weeks.  This meant that she couldn't make any sales and with only her husband's salary, they weren't able to cover all their household expenses, and did not make three of their repayments on time.

This time she wants the loan for the purchase of stone, sand, iron, pebbles, etc.

loans.use: to build a wall.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.es:
Rufina tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Maranura de la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en el asentamiento humano de Cotowincho del distrito de Urubamba. Rufina se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, pollos y patos, ella también se dedica a la venta de frutas que  trae de la zona del valle de La Convención. Rufina en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas.  

El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.

El departamento del Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Rufina is 45 years old and is married; she has four children from this relationship.  She was born in the city of Maranura in the province of La Convención in Cusco department, but she currently lives in the settlement of Cotowincho in Urubamba district.  Rufina works raising small animals, for example guinea-pigs, chickens and turkeys.  She also works selling fruit, which she brings from the La Convención valley.   On this occasion, Rufina is requesting the loan to purchase fruit.

The "Munay Tika" communal bank is made up of responsible and hard-working people who are moving their families ahead in life. The majority of the members live in the province of Urubamba in the department of Cuscco, and this is where they undertake their work activities.

The department of Cusco is known for being an area with much tourism and commerce, for its traditional Inti Raymi festival, and because it's the location of Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world.

loans.use: to purchase fruit.

loans.name: Simplecia

texts.en:
Simplecia is 54 years old, married, and has two children. She resides in Mantic Tangub City, Philippines. Simplecia owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn a living. She has been in this business for 20 years earning 3,000 PHP a month.  

Simplecia is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase new items to expand her product offering. In 2012, Simplecia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to build a house and  make sure her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: мавлюда, одна из передовых девятилетних клиентов организации, которая при помощи кредитов смогла развернуть свой товарооборот. Она раньше торговала детской обувью, а сейчас изменила свой ассортимент.Т.к у нас большим спросом пользуется использование женских платков, она решила продавать косынки и шарфы для женщин. Как она говорит, её торговля наладилась и она стала получать хороший доход. За товаром она ездит два раза  в месяц в Истаравшан. Её муж электрик и его доход вполне хватает на жизнь, а доход Мавлюды они тратят на непредвиденные семейные расходы.Мавлюда смогла сама купить новый телевизор, чему она рада и благодарна сотрудничеству с организацией.
texts.en: Mavluda is one of the leading nine-year clients of our organization, who was able to increase her goods turnover with the help of credits.  She previously sold children's shoes and changed her focus since then.  Because women's scarves are in high demand here, she decided to sell scarves and shawls for women.  As Mavluda says, her sales improved, and she started to earn a good income.  She travels for merchandise to Istaravshan twice per month.  Her husband is an electrician, and his income is quite sufficient for living, and they spend Mavluda's income on unexpected family expenses.  Mavluda was able to buy a new television herself, and she is happy and grateful for the partnership with the organization.

loans.use: to purchase a new variety of shawls and scarves

loans.name: Awa

texts.fr: Mademoiselle Awa est âgée de 24 ans et  vit au Sénégal. Elle s’active depuis un an dans  le commerce et la vente de produits divers tels que les produits cosmétiques, les sacs a main et les chaussures. Elle a choisi cette activité par amour et est surtout intéressée  par les retombées financières. Elle est membre d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis octobre 2011. Elle sollicite un crédit de 100 000 frs prévu pour l’acheter des parfums car elle a l’intention de redémarrer son commerce de parfum.
texts.en: Miss Awa is 24 years old and lives in Senegal.  She has been in the business of selling various products such as cosmetics, handbags, and shoes  for a year.  She chose this type of work out of love for it and for the financial benefits.  She has been a member of l'U-IMCEC since October 2011.  She is requesting a loan of 100,000 frs in order to buy perfume because she would like to start a perfume business.

loans.use: to buy perfume to sell.

loans.name: 03.03.02 Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Tú is 31 years old, married, and has two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa City, a semi-urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She raises poultry and cattle, which she has been doing for five years. 

Tú is requesting a loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise. The main hardship that Tú faces in her business is the lack of capital. With her profit, Tú hopes to expand her business and to build a new house.

Tú is the group leader of the 03.3.02 Quảng Hưng group, which consists of four members. In 2011, Tú joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.es:
Marcosa tiene 48 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene seis hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del  departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en el asentamiento de Cotowincho del distrito de Urubamba. Marcosa se dedica a la venta de chicha de jora en su domicilio los días lunes, martes y sábados, ella también se dedica a la venta de papa. Marcosa en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar maíz y papa.  

El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.

El departamento del Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Marcosa is 48 years old, married, and has six children from her marriage.  She was born in the city of Urubamba, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department but she currently lives in Cotowincho, in Urubamba district.  Marcosa's business is selling 'chicha de jora' (a traditional, corn-based drink).  She does this from her home on Mondays, Tuesdays and Saturdays.  She also sells potatoes.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy corn and potatoes.

The 'Munay Tika' community bank is made up of responsible and hard-working people who provide for their families.  Most of the members live in Urubamba province, in Cusco department, and this is where they carry out their businesses.

Cusco department is a very well-known tourist spot.  It is known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, 'Machu Picchu'.

loans.use: to buy corn and potatoes

loans.name: Eulogia

texts.es:
Eulogia tiene 37 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad Maranura de la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en el asentamiento de Cotowincho del distrito de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Eulogia se dedica a la venta de fruta que trae del valle de La Convención como por ejemplo mandarina, piña, plátanos, naranjas y otras especies más. Eulogia en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar frutas.  Su sueño de Eulogia es abrir una distribuidora de balones de gas.  

El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.

El departamento del Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Eulogia is 37 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has two children.  She was born in the town of Maranura, in La Convención province, in Cusco department but currently lives in Cotowincho, in Urubamba district, in Cusco department.  Eulogia's business is selling fruit which she brings from La Convención valley such as mandarins, pineapples, bananas and oranges.  On this occasion, she needs a loan to buy fruit.  Her dream is to open a wholesaler's selling gas cylinders.

The 'Munay Tika' community bank is made up of responsible and hard-working people who provide for their families.  Most of the members live in Urubamba province, in Cusco department, and this is where they carry out their businesses.

Cusco department is a very well-known tourist spot.  It is known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world, 'Machu Picchu'.

loans.use: to buy fruit

loans.name: Bokk Jom Ak Jam Group

texts.fr:
le groupe de solidarité Bokk jom ak jam existe depuis le 9 juillet 2011, il est composé de quinze femmes qui habitent le quartier et évoluent dans le même Groupement de Promotion Féminin; elles font du petit commerce.
Pourméra la responsable est âgée de 34 ans, elle est célibataire mère de trois enfants et a deux autres en charge(son neveu et sa nièce)

Elle mène une activité de petit commerce de parfum, crème de beauté et encens "thiouraye" avec une bonne expérience de plus de dix ans.Elle est debout devant habillée en taille basse et a levé la main gauche.


Son prêt lui servira à augmenter les produits à vendre afin d'espérer gagner beaucoup de revenus.

Elle souhaite avec les bénéfices attendus renforcer son activité, épargner et appuyer sa famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Bokk Jom Ak Jam has existed since July 9th, 2011. It is composed of 15 women who live in the same district, are all small retailers and part of the same "Groupement de Promotion Féminin" (a group for the promotion of women).

The group's leader is Pourméra. She is 34 years old, single and the mother of 3 children. She is also responsible for 2 more children (her nephew and niece). She is an experienced trader who has been selling perfumes, beauty creams and "thiouraye" incense for over 10 years. She is standing at the front of the picture, wearing the dress with a dropped waist and holding up her left hand.

Pourméra will use her part of the loan to restock on products for resale in the hopes of generating a lot of revenue. She would like to use her expected profits to strengthen her business, build up her savings and support her family with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy incense and perfume for resale.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Maranura de la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco pero actualmente vive en el asentamiento humano de Cotowincho del distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco. Sonia es profesora y enseña en uno de los centros educativos prestigiosos de la ciudad de Urubamba, ella enseña el nivel inicial y la podemos encontrar trabajando desde las ochos de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde. En esta oportunidad Sonia requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su casa. 

El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.

El departamento del Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Sonia, 28, is married and has two children from this beautiful relationship. She was born in the city of Maranuar in La Convención Province in Cusco Department but now lives in the settlement of Cotowincho in Urubamba District in Urubamba District in Cusco Department. Sonia is a teacher and teaches in one of the prestigious educational centers in the city of Urubamba. She teaches at the beginning level and we can find her working from 8 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. At this time Sonia needs a loan to do maintenance on her house.

The Munay Tika Communal Bank is made up of responsible and hardworking people who are moving their families forward. A majority of the members live in Urubamba Province in Cusco Department where they conduct their economic activities.

Cusco Department is known as a highly commercial tourist zone and for its traditional Inti Raymi celebration and because Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world, is found here,

loans.use: to do maintenance on her house.

loans.name: Zjarkinboy

texts.ru: Жаркинбой парень, который проживает в сельской местности и занимается откормом скота. Он также работает на стройке. но из-за обильного снегопада, он временно не работает и поэтому хочет увеличить численность скота. У него несколько десятков коз, с которых он имеет дополнительный доход с продажи их шерсти.Он сам стрижёт их и продаёт шерсть , местным женщинам , которые производят пряжу и отправляют в Россию. Для увеличения численности коз Жаркинбой решил получить кредит.
texts.en: Zjarkinboy is a young man, who lives in a rural area and is involved in fattening up livestock.  He also works at a construction site, but due to heavy snowfall, he is temporarily unemployed, and this is why he wants to increase livestock quantity.  He has several tens of goats, with which he earns an additional income from sales of their wool.  Zjarkinboy shaves them himself and sells the wool to the local women, who then make yarn and send it to Russia.  Zjarkinboy decided to obtain this loan to increase the quantity of goats.

loans.use: to purchase goats

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Madame Mariama habite au Sénégal. Elle est mariée et mère de 2 enfants. Elle est âgée  de 27 ans et évolue depuis 3 ans dans le commerce et la vente de tissus de cérémonie sur commande. C’est après son mariage qu’elle a choisi cette activité dans le but de se procurer des revenus. Elle  est sociétaire d’un guichet de l’U-IMCEC depuis aout 2011 et n’a jamais bénéficié de crédit dans la dite institution. Elle sollicite un prêt de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de tissus qui seront destinés a la vente.
texts.en:
Mariama lives in Senegal. She is 27 years old, married and mother to 2 children. She has been working as a small retailer for 3 years and sells ceremonial fabrics to order. She chose this line of work after getting married, with the aim of earning an income.

Mariama has been a member of a UIMCEC branch since August 2011 and has not previously benefited from a loan from the institution. She is now requesting a loan of 400 000 francs which she plans to use to buy fabric for resale.

loans.use: to buy fabric for resale.

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.es:
Tomasa tiene 42 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un  hijo, ella nació en el asentamiento urbano de Cotowincho del distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. Tomasa se dedica a la venta de comida en una de las calles principales del asentamiento cotowincho, ella prepara diferentes tipos de platos de comida como por ejemplo caldo de gallina, caldo de cabeza de res y otros más. En esta oportunidad Tomasa requiere el préstamo para comprar carne de cordero y gallina. 

El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.

El departamento del Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Tomasa is 42 years old and lives with her common-law partner with whom she has a son. She was born in the urban settlement of Cotowincho in Urubamba Disgtrict in Urubamba Province in Cusco Department and still lives in the same city where she was born.

Tomasa sells food on one of the principal streets of Cotowincho. She prepares different types of dishes such as, for example, chicken soup, beef head soup and others. At this time Tomasa needs a loan to purchase lamb and chicken.

The Munay Tika Communal Bank is made up of responsible and hardworking people who are moving their families forward. A majority of the members live in Urubamba Province in Cusco Department where they conduct their economic activities.

Cusco Department is known as a highly commercial tourist zone and for its traditional Inti Raymi celebration and because Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world, is found here.

loans.use: to buy lamb and chicken.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a married woman who has three children. She is 48 years old and resides at Calabayan, Ozamiz City, Philippines. 

Lina owns and operates a banana plantation for a living and has been in this business for five years. Each month she earns PHP 3,000 doing this type of business. She requested a loan of PHP 5,700 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise. 

In 2008, Lina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings, and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
This is Jennifer, 34, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Edmond, a tricycle driver and father to her children. She and her husband manage their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Jennifer operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jennifer hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 47 años es una madre soltera de 4 hijos, pero solo vive con 2. Vive con ellos en una casa propia en el distrito de Tarma. Carmen es una mujer coraje. Ha pasado por diferentes problemas desde que se separó del padre de sus hijos. No obstante, ella supo sobresalir y enfrentar los problemas económicos, para mantener a sus 4 hijos. Gracias a su esfuerzo 2 de ellos ya son independientes; y ahora solo se encarga de cuidar a los 2 menores.
Es así que, abrió un negocio en su propia casa. Ahí expende productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, verduras y otros comestibles. Además acondicionó mesas y sillas a su local de atención para convertirlo en un restaurante.
“Vendo desayunos y almuerzos de lunes a sábados, y los comensales son fieles a mi sazón”, comenta.
Lleva 5 años en el negocio de comidas, pero más de 15 con la bodega, todo lo obtenido es fruto de su esfuerzo y apoyo de MFP, por lo que muestra gran agradecimiento. Ahora solo tiene 2 hijos en su poder, a los que educará y mantendrá hasta que obtengan su propia independencia. Carmen obtendría su crédito número 13 de MFP, como en los ciclos anteriores, manifiesta que será puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “GS-006”, cuyas integrantes son mujeres y comparten las mismas ansias de emprendimiento. De recibir el dinero, Carmen construirá el baño de su local para atender con mayor comodidad a sus comensales. Comprará ladrillos, cemento, mayólica y otros.
texts.en:
47-year-old Carmen is a single mother.  She has four children but only lives with two of them.  She lives in her own home, in Tarma district.  Carmen is a brave woman.  She has experienced a number of problems since she separated from her children's father but she has known how to do well and face her financial problems in order to support her four children.  Thanks to her efforts, two of her children are now independent and she only has to care for her two youngest.

Carmen opened a business in her own home.  There she sells household essentials such as groceries, vegetables and other food products. In addition, she also set up some tables and chairs in her premises and turned it into a restaurant.

"I sell breakfasts and lunches, from Monday to Saturday, and my diners are loyal because of my seasoning", she says.

Carmen has been working in her food business for 5 years and in the grocery store business for more than 15.  Everything she has obtained is down to her own hard work and the support of MFP, for which she is very grateful.  Now she only has two children in her care and she will educate them and support them until they become independent.

This will be Carmen's 13th loan from MFP.  She pledges to be punctual in making her repayments as she was with her previous loans.  She belongs to the 'GS-006' community bank.  Its members are women who share the same entrepreneurial desire. Carmen will use use the money she receives to build a bathroom in her premises so that she can serve her diners more comfortably.  She will buy bricks, cement, tiles, etc.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement and tiles to refurbish her business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene  cinco hijos, ella nació en el asentamiento Urbano de Cotowincho del distrito de Urubamba de la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. María se dedica a la venta de comida y tiene un pequeño restaurante en la entrada del asentamiento humano Cotowincho, ella prepara diferentes tipos de platos de comida como por ejemplo menú familiar, comida tipas de la región y otros. En esta oportunidad María requiere el préstamo para comprar productos al por mayor pues no le sale a cuenta que comprar por pequeñas cantidad entonces va comprar sacos de arroz, bidones de aceite y sacos de azúcar.  

El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la provincia de Urubamba  del departamento del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.

El departamento del Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Maria is 50 years old and married with five children. She was born in the urban settlement of Cotowincho in Urubamba District in Urubamba Province in Cusco Department and still lives in the same city where she was born.

Maria sells food and has a small restaurant at the entrance to Cotowincho settlement. She prepares different types of dishes such as, for example, a family menu, traditional regional food and others. At this time Maria needs a loan to purchases ingredients wholesale because it is not economical to buy in small quantities. She will purchase sackfuls of rice, drums of cooking oil and sacks of sugar.

The Munay Tika Communal Bank is made up of responsible and hardworking people who are moving their families forward. A majority of the members live in Urubamba Province in Cusco Department where they conduct their economic activities.

Cusco Department is known as a highly commercial tourist zone and for its traditional Inti Raymi celebration and because Machu Picchu, one of the seven wonders of the world, is found here.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of rice, drums of cooking oil and sacks of sugar.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen de 47 años, es una mujer soltera. Tiene 2 hijos de 16 y 12 años que cursan estudios secundarios. Ella y sus hijos viven en un departamento alquilado en el distrito de Tarma. Carmen demuestra coraje y fuerza de trabajo. Desde jovencita se dedicó al negocio. Empezó preparando queques, los que vendía de puerta en puerta. Luego se dedico a la compra y venta de quesos, yogurt natural y manjar blanco. Hace 8 años incursionó en la venta de productos por catálogo.
Actualmente, Carmen es una mujer que no descansa. La venta de productos por catálogo es lo que realzó su economía. “Ofrezco productos de distintos catálogos y los pedidos que me hacen al mes, me abastece para mis gastos básicos y algo más”, menciona. Lo que más vende son los cosméticos, perfumes y joyas. La ropa, zapatos y otros accesorios tienen temporadas donde suben sus precios y le conviene, pero manifiesta que siempre tiene ventas.
Con los queques, los productos lácteos y artículos de catálogo puede asegurar que sus metas van alcanzándose, pero ella espera más. Con su esfuerzo y dedicación piensa adquirir una casa propia, es una de sus metas más anheladas. Carmen obtendría su crédito número 13 de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual con el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “GS-006”, es el nombre de su banco comunal, del que se siente contenta e identificada por que sus compañeras tienen los mismos objetivos. Con el dinero que recibiría, adquirirá mercaderías para sus distintos negocios. Ahora tiene un pedido de zapatos, cosméticos y ropa, el que pagará para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Carmen, aged 47, is single.  She has two children aged 16 and 12, who are attending secondary school.  She and her children live in a rented apartment in  Tarma district.  Carmen shows courage and hard work; she has worked since she was a young girl.  She began by baking cakes which she sold door-to-door.  At a later point, she started buying and selling cheese, natural yogurt and blancmange.  Eight years ago, she started selling products from catalogs.

Currently, Carmen is a women who never rests.  Her sales of products from catalogs are what drive her finances.  "I offer products from different catalogs, and the orders that I get each month keep me covered for my basic expenses and more", she says.  What she sells most are cosmetics, perfumes, and jewelry.  Clothing, shoes and other accessories have seasons where they raise their prices, but she shows that she always has sales.

Between the cakes, the dairy products and the catalog items, she is able to ensure that her goals can be reached, but she is hoping for more.  With her effort and dedication, she is thinking about acquiring her own home, which is one of her most longed-for goals.

Carmen will be taking out her 13th loan from MFP, and agrees to be punctual with her monthly repayments.  "GS-006" is the name of her communal bank, which she is happy and identifies with, because her colleagues have the same objectives.  With the money that she will receive, she will acquire more merchandise for her various businesses.  She currently has an order for shoes, cosmetics, and clothing which she will pay so that she can offer them for sale to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics, shoes and clothing.

loans.name: Thu's Group

texts.en:
Thu is 19 years old. She is running a small grocery shop that opened one year ago.  Her business creates stable income for her family.  Participating in our credit program in 2011, she used the loans effectively in expanding her shop and she engaged in a good repayment situation. She wants to have a loan of 7,392,000 VND to buy more products to meet the demands of her customers.

De is 56 years old. Being a farmer, she grows rice and raises chickens. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy fertilizer and food.

An is 30 years old. She is running a shoe shop in the local market. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy more new design shoes.

Minh is 53 years old. He is raising fish. He wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy more products to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Maria Nena

texts.en:
Maria Nena is 54 years old, married, and has children  She is a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. Together with her husband, she manages their  household while operating their business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Nena operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, some cooking oil, or an egg. Maria Nena earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells directly for additional income. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, Maria Nena is requesting a loan for 14,000 PHP, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria Nena hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the study of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Carolina , es habitante del municipio de ticuantepe , junto a su familia , ella es madre soltera , lucha dia a dia para poder mejorar las condiciones de vida , desde hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación que se le presenta son las plagas que invaden el cultivo y en estos momentos no cuenta con los recursos economicos necesarios para comprar los fertilizantes e insumos necesarios para inducir en tiempo y forma el cultivo , ya que si logra aplicarle dichos producctos logrará sacar una producción de calidad y esto sera de muchos beneficios en cuanto a los economico , agradece el apoyo que le brinda Afodenic atravez de Kiva .
texts.en: Carolina lives in the town of Ticuantepe together with her family.  She is a single mother who works hard every day in order to improve her living conditions.  She has been growing pineapples for some years.  The biggest problem she faces is pests which invade her crops.  Right now, she doesn't have the money she needs to buy fertilizers and other supplies with which to encourage her crops' growth both in terms of time and shape.  If she manages to apply these products, she will achieve a good-quality production.  This will be a great financial benefit to her.  She is grateful for the support that Afodenic offer her through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and farming supplies

loans.name: Guisela

texts.es:
Guisela de 33 años es una madre soltera. Tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 2 años de edad. Ella y sus hijos viven en la casa de sus parientes en el distrito de Tarma. Guisela es una joven alegre y positiva. Hace 10 años empezó a laborar en trabajos eventuales. Gracias a su persistencia logró adquirir computadoras, las que ahora utiliza para brindar el servicio de Internet. Atiende principalmente a estudiantes que viven por su barrio, y comenta que le va bien en el negocio.
“tengo 5 máquinas las que alquilo a 1 sol la hora”, dice. Además, vende discos de videos de películas y conciertos, en el mismo local, agregando más ingresos a su familia.
Una de las preocupaciones de Guisela es el mantenimiento de sus computadoras, para optimizar el funcionamiento de las mismas. Ella espera adquirir más máquinas y aumentar sus servicios con la instalación de un locutorio público para realizar llamadas hacia diferentes destinos, para eso seguirá trabajando. Éste sería su crédito número 13 que recibiría de MFP gracias a su ayuda. Da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas como lo fue anteriormente. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “GS-006”. Le gusta el trabajo que desarrollan por ser solidario.
De obtener el dinero, Guisela podrá pagar el mantenimiento de las máquinas. También comprará nuevos discos de videos para ofrecerlos en su local.
texts.en:
33-year-old Guisela is a single mother.  She has two children who are 9 and 2 years old.  She and her children live in her relatives' house in Tarma district.  Guisela is a cheerful and positive young woman.  Ten years ago she started doing temp work.  Thanks to her persistence, she managed to acquire some computers which she now uses to provide an Internet service.  She mainly serves the students who live in her neighborhood and she says that her business is doing well.

"I have five machines which I rent out for 1 sol an hour", she says.  In addition, Guisela also sells movie and music DVDs from the same premises.  This makes extra income for her family.

One of the worries that Guisela has is that her computers need maintenance work carrying out on them in order to optimize their performance.  She hopes to acquire more machines and to increase her services by installing a 'locutorio' (a public telephone exchange) so that people can make calls to different places.  She will continue working to achieve this.

This will be Guisela's 13th loan from MFP thanks to your help.  She gives her word that she will be punctual in making her repayments as she has been in the past.  She belongs to the 'GS-006' community bank and enjoys the work that they carry out to foster team spirit.  Guisela will use her money to pay to have her machines serviced.  She will also buy new video discs to sell in her business.

loans.use: to have maintenance work carried out on her computers and to buy video games

loans.name: Yearn

texts.en:
Yearn is 60 years old, widowed and resides with a son and a daughter in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for over three years, earning approximately $8 a day. Yearn's children are employed. Her son sells bags and earns approximately $5 a day. Her daughter sells clothes in the market and earns approximately $10 a day. 

Yearn is requesting a loan for $1,200, which she will use to buy more bags and clothes for her children's businesses to generate more profits to support the family. In the future, she would like to expand her children’s businesses and rebuild her present house to make it much stronger to provide better living conditions for her family

loans.use: to purchase bags and clothes to reell.

loans.name: Subon

texts.ru: Субон- мужчина, который занимается откормом и продажей скота. Он сам по профессии строитель, и работает в бригаде.Его доход с стройки в основном в летний период, а зимой он занимается как покупкой и продажей скота, так и откормом и продажей скота. Сейчас у него десять голов баранов и коз, которые пасутся днём на пастбище, а вечером их пригоняет местный пастух. Субон очень пунктуальный и честный человек, который искренне благодарен всем инвесторам организации за понимание и поддержку. В день мониторинга места деятельности Субон был на работе в Кансае, поэтому на снимке он в день выдачи.
texts.en: Subon is a man, who is involved in fattening up and selling livestock.  His profession is a construction worker, and he works in a brigade.  His salary from construction comes mainly during the summer, and in the winter, he is involved in buying and selling livestock, and fattening up and selling livestock.  Currently, he has ten heads of sheep and goats, which go to a pasture during the day, and a local shepherd brings them back in the evening.  Subon is a very punctual and honest person, who is genuinely grateful to all investors of the organization for their understanding and support.  Subon was at work in Kansai during the monitoring, and this is why the photograph shows him on the day of disbursement.

loans.use: to purchase sheep and goats

loans.name: Murodali

texts.ru: Муродали проживает в районе Хамадони. Ему 46 лет. Он женат. Муродали имеет высшее педагогическое образование. По профессии он проработал три года. На сегодняшний день он предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он имеет богатый опыт. Кредит берет для ремонта автомашины.
texts.en: Murodali lives in the Hamadoni district.  He is 46 years old, married.  Murodali has a higher, pedagogical education.  He spent three years working in his field.  Today, he provides a taxi service.  He has a rich experience in this business.  Murodali is requesting this loan to repair his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Manuel Jerónimo

texts.es:
El señor Manuel Jerónimo es casado, reside en el departamento de Masaya, cuenta con 23 años de experiencia en el negocio de elaboración de calzado para damas, caballeros y colegiales, cuenta con clientes que le compran desde Costa Rica, y la gran mayoría en Masaya.    

Siempre ha trabajado con préstamos, y comenta que le sirven de mucha ayuda, ya que con eso ha salido adelante con su negocio. Actualmente, por la temporada de colegio, está necesitando invertir más al negocio y por eso se acerca a Ceprodel para solicitar un préstamo e invertir en la compra de materiales tales como pega amarilla y blanca, forro fino, azulón, brasiles, cajuela, fibra, royal, cambrellon, hilo, ojetas, plataforma, charoles.. Y de esa manera cubrir la demanda de manera rápida y aumentar más sus ventas.
texts.en:
Manuel Jerónimo is married and lives in Masaya department.  He has 23 years experience in making footwear for ladies, men and schoolchildren.  He has customers who buy his products from Costa Rica.  Most of his customers are from Masaya.

Manuel has always worked with loans and he says that they are very helpful as they have enabled him to make progress in his business.  As it is currently the back-to-school season, he needs to invest more in his business.  For this reason, he approached Ceprodel to request a loan to invest in buying materials such as yellow and white glue, fine lining, fiber, shank plates, boxes, thread, eyelets, platforms and patent leather.  This will enable him to cover his demand quickly and he will be able to further increase his sales.

loans.use: to buy yellow and white glue, fine lining, fiber, shank plates, thread, eyelets, platforms and patent leather

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
This is Helen, 42, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Romeo, a mechanic and father to her children. Together with her husband, Helen manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Helen operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 24,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Helen hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; here she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana tiene 40 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos, ella nació en la ciudad de Maranura del distrito de Quillabamba de la provincia de La Convención del departamento del Cusco pero vive en la ciudad de Urubamba. Susana se dedica a la venta de fruta, ella compra sus productos en el valle de La Convención y después los distribuye en el valle sagrado ósea en las ciudades de Urubamba, Calca, Ollantaytambo, Pisaq y Cusco.    En esta oportunidad Susana requiere el préstamo para comprar más fruta.

El banco comunal “Munay Tika” está conformado por personas responsables y trabajadores que sacan adelante a su familia. La mayoría de los socios viven en la provincia de Urubamba del departamento del Cusco y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.

El departamento del Cusco es conocido por ser una zona muy turística, comercial, por su fiesta tradicional del Inti Raymi y porque se encuentra una de las siete maravillas del mundo “Machupicchu”.
texts.en:
Susana is 40 years old and has a common-law marriage.  She has two children.  Susana was born in the town of Maranura, in Quillabamba district, La Convención province, Cusco department.  However, she now lives in the city of Urubamba.  Susana's business is selling fruit.  She buys her products in La Convención valley and then sells them in 'El Valle Sagrado' (The Sacred Valley), in the cities of Urubamba, Calca, Ollantaytambo, Pisaq and Cusco.  On this occasion, Susana needs a loan to buy more fruit.

The members of 'Munay Tika' community bank are responsible and hard-working people who provide for their families.  Most of the members live in Urubamba province, in Cusco province, and this is where they carry out their business activities.

Cusco department is a well-known tourist and commercial area.  It is known for its traditional Inti Raymi festival and because it is home to one of the seven wonders of the world: Machu Picchu.

loans.use: to buy more fruit

loans.name: Sameeha

texts.en:
Sameeha is a 34-year-old married woman from Madaba, Jordan and a mother of five children.

Sameeha has a promising home-based project. She is producing dairy products and requesting a loan of 400 JD to to purchase materials needed in making dairy products.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed in making dairy products

loans.name: Linh's Group

texts.en:
Linh is 40 years old with two children. One of them is school-aged.  Being a farmer, Linh grows rice and raises chickens. Her business started many years ago.  Having heard about our credit program through her neighbor, she finds that it is suitable with her family. Therefore, she has requested a loan of  5,152,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

Huong is 35 years old. She is a farmer. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy food for her pigs.

Tham  is 37 years old. Being a farmer, she raises pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy food.

Du is 36 years old.  Being a farmer, she raises chickens for meat. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy food.

Minh is 46 years old. Being a farmer, she raises pigs for meat. She wants to have a loan of 5,152,000 VND to buy food for them.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Maria Corazon

texts.en:
This is Maria Corazon, 54, resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Rodolfo, her business partner and father to her two children. Together with her husband, Maria Corazon manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Maria Corazon operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, 5 PHP-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Maria Corazon hopes to be able to expand soon and dreams of being able to give her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week; there she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en: Lien is 44 years old with two children who are grown. She is running a small grocery shop. Opened  three years ago, it creates 3,500,000 VND of profit per month. Joining in our credit program in 2010, she invested her loan to expand her shop. Currently, she is requiring a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy more products to meet the demands of her customers

loans.use: to buy more products to sell

loans.name: Binh

texts.en: Binh is 29 years old with two children who are small. She is managing a shop that sells construction materials. Her business started three years ago. Joining in our credit program in 2010, she finds it is suitable for her business. Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy more materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy more materials to sell

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Van is 38 years old with two children who are school age.  Her main activity to earn a daily income is selling fresh fruits in the local market. Her business started three years ago. Joining in our credit program in 2010, she used loans in expanding her sales. For her new loan, she is requiring a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy more kinds of fruits to meet the demands of her customers.

loans.use: to buy more kinds of fruits to sell

loans.name: Giang

texts.en: Giang is 33 years old and has 2 children who are at school age. Being a tailor, she runs a tailor shop and make dresses and clothes to order for her customers. Her business started 3 years ago and she got a good profit from this.  Currently, she wants to have a loan of 8,736,000 VND to buy  fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Thao

texts.en:
Thao, 34, is married and has two daughters. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income working as a driver. Thao supports her family by running a business selling small appliances and household items. She started this business seven years ago. 

Thao is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular plates, bowls and small appliances, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her children to school.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular plates, bowls and small appliances

loans.name: Latofat

texts.ru: Латофат более пяти лет занимается животноводством. Ей 38 лет. Она в основном разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Она замужем. У нее пятеро детей. Она берет кредит для закупа телят.
texts.en: Latofat has been involved in animal husbandry for over five years.  She is 38 years old.  She primarily breeds cattle at home.  Latofat is married and has five children.  She is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Mamadou Guéye

texts.fr: Mamadou est un électricien qui exerce ce métier depuis 2005.Il a été auparavant apprenti dans un grand atelier dans sa localité.Aujourd'hui, il gagne des marchand d'installation de réseau électriques dans des bâtiments en construction.
