Carlos se dedica de manera diaria a la crianza y posterior comercialización de animales  como ganado, ovinos y aves de corral como: patos, pavos, cuyes, entre otros, actividad a la que se ha dedicado siempre teniendo ya un aproximado de 5 años de experiencia en el negocio, negocio al que se ha dedicado desde muy pequeño junto a sus padres. Para lo que ha podido instalar en su propia casa espacios estratégicos para la crianza de los mismos, adicionalmente también se genera ingresos diarios trabajando como jornalero en los diferentes fundos cercanos a su caserío, y al cuidado de sus plantaciones de mango que tiene por cosechar ya en una has que de su propiedad.

Carlos al tener ya sus objetivos claros y establecidos desea comprar alimentos balanceados los cuales servirán para el engorde de sus animales y a la vez la compra fertilizantes para mejorar su producción. Carlos ha solicitado un crédito en Edpyme Alternativa por un monto de 2000 Nuevos Soles los cuales ayudaran a generar mayores ingresos con los que podrán mejorar su calidad de vida y a la vez para pagar su crédito solicitado.

Gozan de muy buena relación con vecinos del caserío donde viven debido a que son personas de buen carácter.
texts.en:
Carlos is 41 years-old and the male head of household. He lives with his wife and their two children. The house in which they currently live is located in the very small, rural village Guaraguaos Bajo Lote 80 in the district of Tambogrande. This district belongs to the province of Piura which is located some three hours from the city of Chiclayo. He lives in a rural part of this district in which little is progressing and now he only can rely on basic electric service.

Carlos makes his daily living raising and later selling animals like cattle and sheep, and fowl like ducks, turkey, and guinea pigs, among others. He's always been making a living in this area and already has approximately five years of experience in business. He's been doing this since he was very little with his parents. He has been able to install strategic spaces in his home for the raising of those same ones. Additionally he also makes money working daily as a day laborer on different large farms near his small village and by taking care of the mango plantations that he has to harvest on his property.

Carlos, already having clear and established objectives, wishes to buy feed which will serve to fatten his animals and also fertilizer to improve his production. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for a sum of 2000 Nuevos Saloes which will help him to generate a greater income. This will help them improve their  quality of life and at the same time pay off his requested loan.

They enjoy good relations with their neighbors from the small village due to their good character.

loans.use: to buy feed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Barrio Sucre (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Barrio Sucre, está formado por 12 socias quienes son mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras y laboran en distintas actividades en especial del campo como la crían animales y  la agricultura, también laboran en el comercio y algunos salen diariamente a trabajar en la ciudad regresando por la noche a sus hogares. Viven por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca,  donde se puede disfrutar de grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas viejas unas y modernas construcciones otras, que sin tener el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional no desentonan del todo y más bien le dan variedad al paisaje. Su gente mantiene las tradiciones y cultura de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Juana, tiene 42 años, es divorciada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de los cuales tres son casados y viven independientes, su ultima hija tiene 9 años de edad y  estudia en una escuelita de la localidad. 

Doña Juana se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la agricultura, lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar, también cría cerdos, borregos, cuyes y pollos a los que los vende en su comunidad cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.

Es socia fundadora del banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para seguir creciendo en esta actividad.

Su meta es crecer más en la cría de animales.
texts.en:
The communal Barrio Sucre consists of 12 members, who are hard-working, fighting women who work in different activities but especially in the fields of raising animals and agriculture. They also work in commerce, and some go out daily to work in the city, returning to their homes at night. They live throughout the parish of Cumbe, in Cuenca, where they can enjoy the great pastures of livestock farms, old estates, and estates of modern construction, which, without having the charm of traditional architecture, are not altogether out of place but rather give variety to the landscape. Its people maintain the traditions and culture of their towns. 

One of the members of this group is Señora Juana, who is 42 years old. She is divorced from her husband, but has four children from her marriage. Three are married and live independently. Her youngest daughter is 9 years old and goes to a little school in the town.

Doña Juana works at her household duties and in agriculture. What she harvests is only for consumption in her home. She also raises pigs, lambs, guinea pigs, and chickens, which she sells in her community when she has some economic need.

She is a founding member of the communal bank, and she is going to invest her loan in the purchase of chickens to continue growing in this business. Her goal is to increase her animal-raising business.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Lady Vanessa

texts.es:
En el cantón Rocafuerte se  reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Organizadas. Este lugar se lo conoce por sus deliciosos dulces que preparan los lugareños y que son reconocidos en todo el país.

En este lugar vive la señora Lady, tiene 33 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 14, 10 y 7  años de edad, el mayor  estudian en colegio y  los dos menores en escuela. El marido se dedica a la fabricación de ladrillos.

Ella además de ser una gran ama de casa también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta, también vende artículos para el hogar como licuadoras, planchas, tostadoras entre otras cosas, esto los vende a través de cartillas. Trabaja tres días días de la semana unas seis horas diarias.  Deja a crédito sus productos a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Lo que es ropa la compra en Guayaquil y los productos para el hogar los recibe en una distribuidora en el centro de la ciudad de Portoviejo, lleva 10 años que se dedica a esta actividad y le ha ido muy  bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, sobretodo lo de temporada, trajes de baño, bermudas, camisetas, blusas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 5 años y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que les ofrece la institución.

Su sueño es tener su propio almacén.
texts.en:
In the canton of Rocafuerte all-female members of the communal bank, Mujeres Organizadas, get together every fifteen days. This place is known for its delicious sweets that the locals make and they are known throughout the whole country.

Lady, 33 years-old, lives in this place, and has a common law marriage from which she has three children who are 14, 10, 7 years-old. The oldest studies in high school and the rest are in elementary school. Her husband makes a living making bricks.

Besides being a great housewife, she also makes a living doing business. She sells all types of clothing and her method of selling is going door to door. Also, she sells home goods like blenders, irons, and toasters, among others. She sells these by means of readers. She works three days a week for some six hours daily. She sells her customers products on credit and charges every fifteen days. She buys clothing in Guayaquil and receives the home goods from a distributor in the center of the city of Portoviejo. She has been making a living doing this for ten years and it has gone very well for her.

The loan is to buy clothing- above all seasonal clothing like bathing suits, bermuda shorts,  T-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing. She has been with the communal bank for five years and she is thankful for the help and benefits that the institution offers them.

Her dream is to have her own store.

loans.use: to buy bathing suits, bermuda shorts, T-shirts, blouses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita, de 37 años de  edad es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable. Es viuda y habita en su propia casa en compañía de sus 02 hijos y su madre a quien quiere mucho. La actividad que tiene Margarita es la venta de abarrotes para esto cuenta con una bodega que está instalada en su propia casa. Donde atiende muy amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos, logrando así hacerse conocida y  ganándose su preferencia. Tiene más de 1 año dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su madre, quien atiende cuando ella está fuera de casa.  Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y se siente ocupada, además el poder estar en casa para cuidar y atender  a sus hijos. Considera su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja y la regular demanda que tiene desde que se inició en su negocio. Por tanto tiene planes de seguir creciendo en su negocio y ampliarlo vendiendo bebidas gaseosas. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. 
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería  como abarrotes de primera necesidad para surtir su bodega, así también bebidas gaseosas, en donde buscará precios más cómodos por sus compras en volumen.
texts.en: Margarita is a 37-year-old hard-working woman who is also friendly and happy. She is a widow and lives in her own home with her two children and her mother, whom she loves very much. Margarita makes a living selling groceries out of a store she step up in her home. She kindly tends to her customers, the majority of whom are her neighbors, and has been able to make her store well known and a place of preference. She has dedicated herself to this business for one year and counts on the support of her mother, who tends to the store when Margarita is away from the home. Margarita likes the business because it generates income and keeps her busy, and also because she is able to be at home and care for her children. She considers it to be a lucrative business because of the good profits and the regular demand she has had since she opened the store. She plans to keep growing the business and expand it by selling soft drinks. This will be her first loan with Kiva partner MFP. She is very content knowing she will have financial support so she feels comfortable moving ahead with the business. She plans to invest the money in the purchase of groceries to stock her store, along with buying soft drinks. She is looking to get lower prices by buying in volume.

loans.use: to purchase groceries and soft drinks to stock her store.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 60 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora y empeñosa. Está separada del padre sus hijos. Vive en su propia casa, en compañía de sus hijos, asimismo el mayor está casado y tiene dos hijos. La actividad que realiza Flor es la venta de agregados de construcción que son arena y ripio que se usan en la mezcla con el cemento. Este negocio lo ha constituido en sociedad con su hijo mayor, comprando los agregados en las zonas de playa del puerto de la localidad cercana y los vende a las empresas constructoras y público en general. Tienen más de 10 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su hijo es su mayor apoyo. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico, y le permite tener una ocupación sintiéndose una persona productiva, teniendo los deseos de convertirse  en una prospera empresaria. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, por tanto desea aumentar en stock los materiales que vende. Por otro lado, desea montar una tienda de abarrotes en su propia casa. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se siente bien con banco comunal, pues le gusta el trabajo que realizan apoyando a las personas en avanzar con sus negocios.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de más agregados de construcción para así tener un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en: Flor is 60 years old and a hard-working woman. She is separated from the father of her children. She lives in her own home along with her children, including her eldest son, who is already married and has two children. Flor makes a living selling construction materials like sand and gravel used to make cement. She works in concert with her eldest son, buying the products in the nearby beach areas and selling them to construction companies and the general public. She has more than 10 years of experience with the business, and her son is a big support. She likes the business because it generates income and keeps her being a productive person and feeds the desire to become a prosperous businesswoman. She considers it lucrative work because of the good profits, which is why she wants to expand the amount of materials she sells. At the same time, she wants to set up a convenience store in her home. This will be her 10th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she awaits your collaboration to help continue her objectives. She feels good about her community bank because she like the work it does supporting people who want to advance their businesses. With the money she is requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of more construction materials to have a stock at the ready to sell.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, de 31 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser cordial y alegre. Convive con Eli quien es empleado y padre de su hijo de 8 años. Juntos habitan cómodamente en la casa de sus padres. La actividad que realiza Delia es el transporte, para esto cuenta con un vehículo tri móvil llamado moto taxi, iniciándose con el primero con un crédito familiar hace 03 años que lo alquila diariamente. De esa manera ha ido creciendo y en la actualidad cuenta con 03 unidades. Tiene 03 años dedicándose a éste negocio y cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja en la administración de sus vehículos.  Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico y se siente una persona productiva apoyando a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Por lo contrario no le gusta cuando llueve constante pues dificulta el transporte en las calles y eso malogra  más rápido las unidades. Tiene planes de incursionar en otro negocio como abrir una tienda de venta de repuestos para motos. Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en compra de repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus unidades como llantas, aceites y otros.
texts.en: Delia is a 31-year-old hard-working woman who is also cordial and happy. She lives comfortably in her parents' home with Eli, who works and is the father of her 8-year-old son. She makes a living in transportation with a moto-taxi business. She started with a family loan three years ago and pays it back on a daily basis. In this way she has kept the business growing and now has three moto-taxis. She counts on the support of her partner, who helps administer the vehicles. She likes the business because it generates income and she feels productive supporting Eli with household expenses. On the other hand, she doesn't like it when it rains a lot because it makes the roads difficult and the moto-taxis go slower. She has plans of adding another business, like opening a shop for spare parts. This will be her fourth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she awaits your collaboration so she can solidify her plans. She enjoys being part of her community bank because it is a united group. With the money she is requesting, she plans to invest in the purchase of spare parts like tires, motor oil and other items to maintain her vehicles.

loans.use: to purchase tires and motor oil.

loans.name: Mt.livingstone Group

texts.en:
Halima, who is in her mid 30s, is married with one small child. She has been running a business selling chapati, mandazi, chai, half cake, sodas, water and ladies clothes door to door, for one year now. She works from 7:00 am to 6:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be her eighth loan from Tujijinge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to sell food, plait hair, sell ladies clothes door to door, and increase stock of the bites like half cake, mandazi, and chapati and has paid all loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to increase her capital so that she can buy more half cake, mandazi, chapati, sodas, milk, and 10 kilos of sugar.  Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mt. livingstone", which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to  buy more half cake, mandazi, chapati, sodas, milk, and sugar

loans.name: 06.09.04 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Ngần is applying for a loan to purchase vegetables to resell. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables.

Ngần is 63 years old and she is married with two children..
Ngần is the group leader of the 06.09.04-Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
Ngần lives with two dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Ngần's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Ngần has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Ngần faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Ngần hopes for her business to do well, to remodel her house and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables to resell

loans.name: Conjesta

texts.en:
Conjesta, age 48, is a mother of six children, four of whom are still schooling. She has been in farming for most of her adulthood and currently produces milk, maize, beans, vegetables and eggs for the local market. 

Conjesta has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry farming business. She says the expansion will improve her farming income and make it easier to provide for the family's basic needs. She also adds that she will enjoy the economies of scale with an increased number of birds. She is glad she will be able to educate her children.

She laments of the costly animal feed and difficulty in managing poultry diseases.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Rapheal

texts.en: Rapheal is a 38-year-old man with six children living in Kasese, Uganda. His family goal is to educate his children. He has been a retailer for the last year after starting with capital of 1,000,000 shillings and his business is now worth 1,500,000 shillings. His major hardship is inadequate capital to purchase stock. However, he has a vision of expanding his business to new areas and buying a fridge to preserve the perishables. Rapheal intends to use the loan to buy a fridge and sugar.

loans.use: to buy a fridge and sugar

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 37 years old, married and blessed with four children, aged 17, 15, 10 and 7. She owns a retail shop, a business she started two years ago,  and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

Catherine has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase bundles of baking flour and maize flour, boxes of bar soap, cooking fat and washing detergents.  The profit she makes will be ploughed back to her business. Her dream is to be successful and educate her children.  This is her first loan.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Isaiah

texts.en: Isaiah is 26 years old, married and has one child. He runs a grocery store to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 12 years and has employed four people.  He also sells sugarcane to earn extra income.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Isaiah has been able to grow his business and hopes to be financially stable in the future.  He has applied for 100,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sugarcane, maize, beans and peas to sell.

loans.use: buy sugarcane, maize, beans and peas

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 24 years old, single and supporting his parents.  He sells a variety of items from his shop, which he started two years ago.  He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. 
 
Anthony is requesting for a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase sugar and tea leaves to stock in his business. His profit will help him repay his loan. This is his first loan.

loans.use: buy sugar and tea leaves

loans.name: Pelson

texts.en: Pelson is a thirty-eight-year old married man with four children living in Kagadi, Uganda. He is the sole bread winner of the family and his dream is to educate his children up to the university.  With savings from his monthly salary he was able to construct houses for rent and has been in this business for fifteen years.  His business dream is to own a housing estate.  Pelson needs this loan facility to build more rental houses.

loans.use: build rental houses

loans.name: 01.03.06 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mùi operates a food stall/restaurant selling noodles and rice rolls. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice and pork to make processed food to resell. 

Mùi is 33 years old and married with one child.
She is the leader of a four-member group   the 01.03.06 Đông Sơn solidarity group. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with one dependent.

This is Mùi's first loan with Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women.
Mùi has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Mùi faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Mùi hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase rice and pork

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 44 years old and is a mixed crop farmer.  She is married to Simon, a business man. They are blessed with four children.  Margaret has been a mixed crop farmer for ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,000 which she uses to support her family.

Margaret is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer.  She will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.   With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children.  Her hopes and dreams are to venture in to pig rearing, which will help her improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Resty

texts.en: Resty is 46 years old.  She has 5 children and lives in Hioma, Uganda. She fends for her children without support from any one.  She owns a bar which she started with a loan she acquired and it is steadily growing.  She has a challenge in late payments and bottle breakages by drunk customers.  She hopes to build a permanent house and expand her business to new markets.  Resty needs a loan to buy beer to sell.

loans.use: buy beer

loans.name: 04.12.02 Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Soạn is applying for a loan to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell. She operates a food stall/restaurant selling pork pies and femented pork rolls.  She has been involved in this business for 1 year.

Soạn is 50 years old and is married with 4 children. She lives with 1 dependent in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.  She is the group leader of the 02-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 

In 2009, Soạn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business.  She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Soạn hopes for her children to find a good job, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food for sale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph, 30 years old, runs a retail shop to earn a living. He has been in this business for 10 years and describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since Joseph joined Faulu Kenya, he has been able grow his business and hopes to expand it in the future. Joseph has applied for a loan of 100,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy sugar, beans, peas and  5 sacks of maize

loans.use: To buy sugar, beans, peas and 5 sacks of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
This is Aida, 56, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Jael, her business partner, and father to her children.  She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Aida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo,  PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profit by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece.   Her store is located adjacent to her house.  Her regular customers are her neighbors and people in the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help continue the operations of her business, Aida is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan.  She will utilize the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.  She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Aida hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: buy merchandise for her store

loans.name: Dannis

texts.en:
Dannis is a 25-year-old gentleman from Migori County, west of Kenya and is married to Susan. They have two children between three and five years old.

Dannis operates a motorcycle transport business locally known as boda boda. He has been in this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 4,500. He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy motorbike spare parts. He will use the profits to repay his loan.

His dream is to educate his two children.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorcycle.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga, 31, is single and resides with his mother and a nephew in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia, an area that is well known for its historical tourism sites (ancient temples like Angkor Wat, Bayon, Banteay Srey). He has been running a Tuk Tuk for over five years, earning approximately USD 5 per day. His mother is a Khmer noodle producer who earns approximately USD 3 per day. In order to improve his family's livelihood, Nga is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase maize seeds, watermelon seeds and fertilizer to plant to generate more income for supporting the family. In the future, he hopes to rebuild his present house to make it much stronger to provide better living conditions for the family.

loans.use: to purchase maize seeds, water melon seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
This is Josefina, 58, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Maximo, a farmer, and she is the mother of two children, both in high school. She, together with her husband, manages the household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Josefina operates an ornamental plant business. She grows garden plants that are native to the Philippines like ylang-ylang, golden shower, and dahlias. She also grows a variety of hanging plants and others. Her regular customers are local tourists, neighbors and the nearby community. She earns a minimum of PHP 300 in sales every day

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy fertilizer and garden inputs for her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Josefina dreams of growing her business in the coming years. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for gardening materials and other products needed in her business

loans.name: Jerusa

texts.en:
Jerusa is 49 years old and married to Hezekiah. They are blessed with three children. She is a wholesaler and sells ripe bananas, a business she started four years ago. She earns a monthly income of KES 35,000.

She has requested a loan worth KES 30,000 to purchase bananas to sell. Her profit will help her repay the loan. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase bananas to sell

loans.name: Kirongo Tweimukye Group

texts.en: Matia is 45 years old and living in Kagadi, Uganda. For 10 years, he has been into the brick laying business after diverting from farming. His business is affected by delays in payments and weather factors. However, he has a dream of expanding his business to new areas. Matia is a member of Kirongo Tweimukye, a village group where members guarantee each other. He wants the loan to pay workers who are helping him with brick laying.

loans.use: to pay workers who are helping him with brick laying.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 43 years old and married to Gabriel. They are blessed with four children aged 16, 14, 10 and 7 years respectively.  
To earn a living, she sells timber, a business she started ten years ago. Anne earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

Anne is requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to purchase timber to sell. She will use the profits from the timber sales to reinvest in her business as well as repaying her loan. Her dream is to expand her business to a greater level. This is her first loan.

loans.use: To purchase timber to sell.

loans.name: Parween's Group

texts.en:
Parween is a kind, 48-year-old, Iraqi woman. She is married and has five children. As do many women in Iraq, Parween learned to sew at a young age. Her skills have allowed her to meet her family’s clothing needs during some difficult years.

Ten years ago, Parween decided to put her sewing skills to good use. She started making dresses and accepting custom orders from other families. Working from home, she was able to use her sewing machine and her skills to contribute to her family’s income. 

Parween took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq in the amount of $1,500 to improve her working area and to buy more fabric and materials to provide a wider and better-quality selection for her customers.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" for clients unable to apply for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group.

loans.use: to improve her working area and to buy more fabric and materials.

loans.name: Tara's Group

texts.en:
Tara is one of the many Iraqi widows who are trying to create better living conditions for themselves and their children after the loss of their supportive husbands. 

Tara is a shy, 37-year-old mother of one child. For the past six years, she has been working from home on sewing and tailoring jobs. 

Tara took a loan from Relief International Microfinance Iraq to improve her working area and to buy more fabric and materials to provide a wider and better-quality selection for her customers.

Relief International Microfinance Iraq offers "group loans" to clients unable to qualify for a loan as an individual. As a group, the members collectively guarantee the loan. Groups consist of three to five clients, and each client is evaluated on his or her repayment capacity. All group members receive the same loan amount as the individual with the lowest repayment capacity in the group. 

Based on the political and social challenges of lending in Iraq, personally identifiable information about this borrower has been altered for their protection. RI-Iraq appreciates Kiva lenders' consideration of these challenges and encourages lenders to continue their support of Iraqi borrowers.

loans.use: to improve her working area and to buy more fabric and materials.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 49-year-old lady from Kilgoris town. She is married to Benard and they have four children who are 10, 14, 16 and 18 years old.

Eunice runs a clothes-selling business, a business she has successfully been doing for the last 15 years. She makes a monthly income of 30,000 KES. She is taking her fourth loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more stock of clothing to sell. Her profits will be used to diversify into maize flour grinding.

Her dream is to grow her business so that she is able to provide for her family.

loans.use: To buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.en:
Maria Victoria is 35 years old, married and has 4 children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Maria Victoria runs a variety store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She sells a variety of items such as snack food, soft drinks and other groceries. 

Maria Victoria has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en:
Seraphine is a student applying for a loan to pay tuition fees to help her finish her undergraduate degree at Strathmore University and this is her story:

My name is Seraphine. I am currently a third year student at Strathmore University pursuing a Bachelor of Science degree in Hospitality Management. I have been performing well at Strathmore University with my second year transcript showing an average grade of A. 

I come from a single parent family with my father being the sole breadwinner. He is a small-scale businessman working in the transport sector in Nairobi. I have four siblings who are still in school. This puts an even greater strain on my family's finances, as I am the firstborn.

I also make time to volunteer at a local charity's children’s home. The experience helps to further develop my interpersonal skills as well as giving me an opportunity to give back to society. Moreover, I have part-time jobs at well-known 4 star hotels to help with my upkeep and grow my work experience by honing important skills.

I know that I have great potential despite the financial limitations I currently face, as my consistently good academic performance can attest. Given the opportunity to finish my degree course at Strathmore University, I believe I will graduate as a better, more professional member of society having acquired new skills and become more ethically responsible. I am striving to be an entrepreneur in the hospitality sector and to help others in need.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees to complete a Bachelor of Science degree in Hospitality at Strathmore University.

loans.name: Adams

texts.en:
Adams is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story: 

My name is Adams. I am from a family of eight: three brothers, two sisters, both parents and me. My father is retired and my mother is a nurse. My elder brother, the firstborn, is the only one who works. One other brother is unemployed and one is still in college. My big sister is unemployed and the other one is just starting her career in a newfound job.

I decided to join Strathmore University since it is the best university in the country and I saw it as a means to widen my knowledge and work at achieving my dreams. I am currently pursuing a Diploma in Business Information Technology.

I am taking out a loan for a laptop which I intend to use in my studies. This is because my parents cannot afford to get me one due to financial constraints. I use the university computers when I am at school. It is usually very difficult to access coursework off-campus; this often forces me to leave some assignments undone, inconveniencing me greatly.

I want to major in computer programming. I intend to acquire the necessary skills so that my ultimate goal of starting my own IT firm can be achieved. I intend to counter problems arising technologically and make a significant difference in my country. I have a passion for technology and I want to merge my value of hard work and my passion for technology to make a significant change, both in my family and in my country. I intend to use the laptop to widen my experience in technology and use the experience gained in a positive way.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop which will assist him in his studies, allowing access to courses off-campus.

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in her studies at Strathmore University and this is her story:

My name is Vivian. I am 22 years old and from a single parent family of six. It consists of my mother and five siblings. Currently, I am a second year student at Strathmore University studying for a Bachelor of Commerce degree. I chose Strathmore University as I love business ideas and always wanted to specialize in marketing and accounting. Strathmore University is the leading institution for business courses. l chose it to help me gain the knowledge needed for the job market.

I am applying for a loan to enable me to purchase a laptop which will help me with my research work and provide access to the e-learning site including uploading assignments. This will ensure that I can access my course at any time from anywhere. I will also be able to complete my final year research project on time.

After completing my degree studies, l want to be a financial adviser to corporations in Kenya. l feel l can give a lot to this sector. This laptop will be a major tool in achieving my dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop which will help her with research work and allow access to coursework off-campus and access to the e-learning site.

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
This is Elvera, 38, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Rico, a checker, and she is the mother of two children. By the grace of God, Elvera has managed to support her children's schooling up to college level. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Elvera operates a food stall. In the Philippines. the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 22,000 loan. She will be using the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Elvera dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old. She is a widow with four children. For the past 16 years, Mary has had a clothes-selling business. 

Mary plans to use the proceeds from this loan in order to buy more clothes for sale. With any profits she plans to build a business house. In the future, she wishes to have a booming business.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Warlita

texts.en:
Warlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business selling home appliances in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more appliances like electric irons, DVD/VCDs and other appliances for her selling home appliances business.

Warlita has been in this business for 10 years. Warlita earns additional income from her general store.

Warlita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more appliances like electric irons, DVD/VCDs and other appliances.

loans.name: Sicily

texts.en:
Sicily is 30 years old, single and blessed with one child who is four years old. She sells polythene bags in the area of Babadogo. She has been in this business for the last two years and gets an income of KES 3,650 per month.

Sicily is applying for her first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to buy more polythene bags to sell. She will use the anticipated profit to grow the business. 

She hopes to grow the business and get established.

loans.use: To buy polythene bags to sell

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor, de 53 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dedicada. Es viuda, y vive en compañía de su hijo de 27 años de edad, habitando cómodamente en su propia casa que compró con su difunto esposo. La actividad que realiza Flor es la venta de comidas principalmente almuerzo, brindando pensión a los trabajadores de una empresa cercana a su casa. Realiza la preparación de comida en su casa y los entrega en la empresa a su hora de refrigerio, llegando a ganarse su preferencia por su buena sazón. De esa manera ellos la recomiendan con otras personas, que al cabo de un tiempo se vuelven también sus  clientes habituales. Tiene más de 10 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento su hijo es su mayor apoyo, con la entrega de los alimentos preparados y consiguiéndole nuevos clientes.
Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico, y le permite tener una ocupación y sentirse una persona productiva, además comenta que gracias a éste oficio ha logrado sacar adelante su hogar cuando quedo viuda. Considera rentable su negocio por las buenas ganancias que le deja, por tanto tiene planes de continuar y mas adelante abrir un restaurante en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 15 con la institución MFP. Por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de los ingredientes necesarios para la preparación de sus alimentos como arroz, aceite y otros, deseando conseguir precios más bajos por sus compras en volumen. Y con la otra parte del dinero comprará materiales para habilitar un restaurante en su casa.
texts.en:
Flor, 53, is a hard-working and dedicated woman. She is a widow and she lives with her 27 year-old son. They live comfortably in their own house that Flor bought with her deceased husband. Flor sells food, especially lunch, to workers at a business near her house. She prepares the food in her home and then brings it to the business at their break hour. She came to win the workers' favor with her good flavors. People recommended her to others and after a time, she had developed regular customers. Flor has been running this business for over ten years and up to this point, her son has been her greatest support. He helps deliver the food once it's prepared and helps bring in new customers.

Flor likes this business because it generates good income and allows her to have a job and to feel like a productive person. She also comments that thanks to this work, she has been able to support her household after being widowed. She considers her business to be profitable because of the good earnings she's left with. Therefore, Flor plans to continue with her business and to open a restaurant in her house in the future. This will be her 15th loan through MFP. She is hoping for a small loan so that she can meet her objectives. Meanwhile, she comments that she feels pleased with her communal bank because she considers it to be a united and supportive group.

Flor will invest the requested 2,000 nuevos soles in the purchase of necessary ingredients for preparing her dishes, such as rice, oil, and other ingredients. She hopes to obtain the lowest prices by purchasing in volume. With the other part of the money, she will buy materials to set up a restaurant in her home.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, and perishable goods, as well as materials to set up a restaurant in her home

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a student applying for a loan to purchase a laptop to assist in his studies at Strathmore University and this is his story: 

I am a 20-year-old Strathmore University student. I come from a family of five including my mother, two sisters and one brother. My mother is the sole provider for the family and works as a housewife. I happen to be the only one in my family fortunate enough to attend university – the others' dreams for the same were never realized due to financial constraints that terminated their education as early as primary school. 

I am currently a second year student pursuing a Bachelor of Business Information Technology degree. The courses revolve around computers and I depend entirely on the university computer labs to do the IT projects. The projects are really demanding and require constant contact with computers, even during the weekends when it is not possible to utilize the labs as other classes are also held there.

My efforts to solicit funds to purchase a laptop have been rendered futile; thus, I have decided to apply for a loan. The laptop will go a long way in assisting my studies, as notes will always be available and I will be able to complete projects on time. My laptop will also be available to church youths for educational movies during the long holidays. It will enable me to leave nothing pending in my academic life and ensure I graduate in the stipulated time. After graduation, I will venture into teaching to disseminate the knowledge and life skills I have gained in life, after which I will pursue a Master's. I would also like very much to be involved in community welfare programs to put a smile in children's lives which might be denied by financial constraints.

loans.use: to purchase a laptop which will help him with his projects.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is a student applying for a loan to complete an undergraduate degree at Strathmore University and this is his story:

I am Justus. I am the first born in a family of seven children, four of whom are in high school and two in primary school. I am currently in the third year of my studies, pursuing a degree course in Hospitality Management at Strathmore University. I have faced a lot of difficulties paying my school fees since I joined Strathmore in 2009. I come from a humble background as my parents are not in any formal employment. My dad is a local welder and my mother is a peasant farmer. I have always depended on donors and well-wishers to pay for my school fees and even to pay for my younger brothers in high school. 

I am a bright student who has always maintained a top position in class. I have a lot of dreams and aspirations to help other bright but needy students access quality education and be the persons they want to be in the future. It is in this regard that I am kindly applying for this loan so as to enable me to complete my degree studies. 

In addition, I would like to thank the Kiva organization for this initiative, which I count as a blessing; more so at this time when I had almost lost hope in my education due to my financial constraints. Strathmore University has always been, and will forever be, the best educational institution due to the codes of conduct that it instills in its students. The institution enables people to develop virtues and be responsible members of society once they leave campus. 

In particular, studying at Strathmore has enabled me to acquire the moral virtues required of an honest and responsible citizen. This has been made possible through the units that are taught: for example, Principles of Ethics, Theology, Social and Political Philosophy, and Philosophical Anthropology among others. The dress code has also enabled me to act and carry myself in a professional manner at all times. All these qualities and culture are very rare in most public and private universities in Kenya.

After my graduation, I aspire to come up with a small business entrepreneurship, probably in the hotel industry, or get some employment which will not only enable me to pay back my loan, but will also give me an opportunity to help bright and needy students access higher education.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees in order to complete an undergraduate course in Bachelor of Tourism Management

loans.name: Erick

texts.en:
Erick is a student applying for a loan to pay for his tuition fees to help finish his undergraduate degree at Strathmore University and this is his story:

I am Erick, the fourth born child in a family of five children. My mother is a primary school teacher and my father lost his job in April, 2011. All my siblings are also in university levels, and they also need a lot of financial support from my parents who are low income earners. This makes it hard for them to manage providing for all our education needs. This has made me fear for my future; thus, making me think of ways of completing my studies.

I am currently in my second year undertaking a degree in Bachelor in Business Information Technology at Strathmore University. I chose Strathmore University because it moulds students to be responsible, hardworking, God-fearing and highly motivated professionals. Its academic standards are also much higher than other universities in Kenya.

I have dreams of becoming an IT expert in web and mobile programming to put into practice what I have learnt in school. I also want to help in improving and developing the technology world and to aid in moving Kenya into technological standards that will help curb poverty and other social problems.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees to help him finish an undergraduate degree in Bachelor of Business Information Technology at Strathmore University

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 33 years old, married and has two children who are in school. She and her family live in the Philippines.

Mary Ann is in the agricultural business, raising pigs. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy feed and additional piglets. Mary Ann has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed three times from NWTF in the past in order to sustain the business.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and additional piglets.

loans.name: Amale

texts.en:
Amale is a 49-year-old Lebanese woman. She’s married and living with her husband. They’re cooperating together to be able to satisfy their needs. Her husband has had his own car spare parts shop since the year 2000.  As for Amale, she works really hard and opened her own grocery shop in 2008. She has a wide variety of goods and products, also a fair number of loyal customers. 

Today, she’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added products for her shop such as soft drinks, dairy products and many other items. She notes that this loan will increase her sales and therefore her profits thus her revenue. In the future, she plans to open her own mini-market.

loans.use: to purchase added products for her shop such as soft drinks, dairy products and many other items.

loans.name: Sahar

texts.en:
Sahar is a forty-eight-year-old Lebanese married woman. She’s living with her husband and two school-aged children. With the cooperation of her husband who has been working as a taxi driver, they were capable of covering all their needs. 

Sahar started to work as hair dresser in 1990 from her home. She also visits her customers, who believe in her stylish haircut designs. Today, she’s requesting a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new hair dressing tools. This will develop her business and increase the number of her clients. 

In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and open her own hair-dressing salon.

loans.use: to buy new hair-dressing tools.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children who are still attending school. He’s the main income provider in his family and the one covering his children’s educational fees. 

Ali decided to start doing bodywork and painting for cars in 2007 and has more than twenty years of experience in this domain. In parallel, he works as a taxi driver. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added equipment and painting tools for his garage. This Kiva loan will certainly develop his business and help him attract new customers. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and improve his garage.

loans.use: to purchase added equipment and painting tools for his garage.

loans.name: Kawsar

texts.en:
Kawsar is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her three children; one of them is studying and the others are working. Unlike other women in her age, Kawsar helps her husband, who has been working outside the country for the past three years,  to satisfy her family demands. She’s a good farmer and a hard worker. She has been working in this domain for the past twelve years. 

Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase seeds and chemicals in order to grow her farm. In the future, she plans to buy new land and diversify her harvest.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and chemicals in order to grow her farm.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 37-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and three children who are all studying. Her husband is the one responsible for his family; they’re all united and cooperative. Zeinab started to work as a tailor from her home in 2008. In parallel, she works in a local company.  As for her husband, he has been working in the construction field for the past fifteen years. 

Today, Zeinab is looking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a new tailoring machine which will boost her productivity. In the future, she plans to open her own tailoring shop.

loans.use: to purchase a new tailoring machine.

loans.name: Nazek

texts.en:
Nazek is a 39-year-old Lebanese married woman. She’s living with her husband and four children, who are all attending school. She cooperates with her husband in order to satisfy the family's needs and be capable to live life as it should be. 

Nazek has owned a clothing shop since 2007 and has gained a fair number of customers so far. As for her husband, he has been working as a painter for the past 11 years. 

Today, she’s requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added clothes such as dresses, scarves, pants and many other items. She notes that this loan will certainly push her to get higher returns. In the future, she plans to open other branches as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase added clothes such as dresses, scarves, pants and many other items.

loans.name: Chumagul

texts.ru: Чумагуль женщина из сельской местности, которая занимается уходом за скотом. Её муж на заработках в России, поэтому она вместе с сыном справляется с бизнесом. Чумагуль кроме этого занимается шитьём матрасов, но из-за холодной зимы у неё мало заказов на их пошив. Для покупки корма ей не хватает денег, а баранов необходимо зимой кормить камбикормом, а не только сеном. Поэтому для покупки несколько мешков корма и пяти баранов она решила получить кредит.
texts.en: Chumagul originally comes from the countryside. She raises the livestock. Her husband works in Russia; therefore, Chumagul and her son take care of the business.  Besides raising the livestock, Chumagul sews mattresses. However, she did not have much work because of the cold winter. It is important that the sheep eat the combined feed in winter, but now only hay. However, Chumagul does not have enough money to buy the feed for her sheep. She therefore decided to get a loan to buy several sacks of feed and five sheep.

loans.use: to purchase 5 sheep and feed

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo, de 29 años de edad, es una hombre trabajador y emprendedor, además de ser amable y cordial tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Está casado con Erika quien es empleada  y madre de sus dos hijos de 12 y 5 años de edad. Juntos habitan la casa de sus padres en compañía de su mamá, su papá y su hermana. La actividad que desea iniciar Pable es la venta de parrillas de diversas carnes como maruchas, mollejas, pollos y otros, ya que cuenta con los conocimientos habiendo estudiado para cheff. Piensa instalar su negocio en un espacio disponible en la casa de sus padres desde atendería de manera amable y cordial a su clientela buscando de esa manera ganarse referencia y que le recomienden con otras personas. Para empezar trabajaría solo y viendo la demanda y la necesidad buscaría personal para que le apoyen.
Le gusta esta actividad pues conoce de cocina habiendo trabajado de empleado como cocinero, ganando experiencia. Considera este negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que ha visto que deja. Por tanto, tiene planes de iniciarse lo antes posible y trabajar arduo para hacer crecer su negocio. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además comenta que le gusta el trabajo que vienen realizando en su banco comunal por el apoyo que brindan a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra de asador parrillero valorizado en 450 nuevos soles y con el saldo, mesas y sillas.
texts.en:
29-year-old Pablo is a hard-working and entrepreneurial man who is also kind and friendly.  He has a great desire to do well.  He is married to Erika who is an employee and the mother of his two children who are 12 and 5 years old.  They live together in his parents' home, together with his mom, dad and sister.

Pablo would like to set up a business selling grilled meats such as 'maruchas' (chuck 7-bone pot roast), 'mollejas' (sweetbreads), chicken, etc.  He has the knowledge that he needs as he studied to be a chef.  He plans to set up his business in a free space in his parents' home where he will serve his customers in a kind and friendly manner so that they recommend him to other people.  To begin with, Pablo will work alone and then, depending on his demand and needs, he will look for staff to support him.  He enjoys this business because he knows all about cooking, having worked as a chef and gained experience in the field.  He considers this business to be profitable as he has seen the good profits that it makes.  He has plans to set up his business as soon as possible and to work hard so that he can grow his business.

This will be Pablo's first loan from MFP.  He hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can carry out his plans.  He says that likes the work that his community bank does and the support that they give people.  Pablo will use the 800 soles that he has requested to invest in buying a barbecue grill that costs 450 soles and then he will buy tables and chairs with the remainder of the money.

loans.use: to buy a barbecue grill, tables and chairs

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y amable. Convive con Niel quien es comerciante y padre de sus 03 hijos. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Nellly es la venta de productos de belleza como cosméticos, cremas,  perfume, entre otros. Todos estos productos son adquiridos por catálogo y los vende desde su casa a sus amistades, familiares y vecinos, a quienes atiende de manera amable y cordial, ganándose de esa manera su preferencia. Tiene más de 5 años dedicándose a éste negocio, y hasta el momento lo realiza sola. Le gusta su negocio por el tiempo libre para dedicarse a otras actividades, además de tener un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene y las buenas ganancias que le deja.  Por tanto, tiene planes de continuar con su negocio, buscando hacerlo crecer. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues conoce a sus integrantes ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como cosméticos, perfumes entre otros, para tener un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
47-year-old Nelly is a hard-working and determined woman who is also kind and friendly.  She lives with Niel who is a salesman and the father of her three children.  They live comfortably together in their own home.  Nelly's business is selling beauty products such as cosmetics, creams, perfumes, etc.  She acquires all these products through catalogs and sells them from her home to friends, family members and neighbors who she serves in a kind and friendly manner, thereby gaining their loyalty.  Nelly has been in this business for more than five years and, up to now, she has worked alone.  She enjoys her business because it gives her free time to spend on other activities and also makes her income so that she can support her partner with the household expenses.  She considers the business to be fairly profitable because of the demand she has and the good profits she makes.  For this reason, she plans to continue working and would like to grow the business.

This will be Nelly's second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  For her part, she says that she feels happy with her community bank because she knows that the members are responsible and supportive people.  Nelly will invest the 1,000 soles that she has requested in buying merchandise such as cosmetics, perfumes, etc. so that she has stock available to sell.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics and perfumes

loans.name: Diona

texts.en:
Diona works hard to support her family. Diona is married and has a business selling personal products in the Philippines.

Diona requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more products to sell.

Diona has been in this business for 7 years.

In the future, Diona would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is aged 28 years. He is a father of one child aged 8 months. 

Daniel owns a hardware store. He has been running the business for the last 7 years. 

With the loan he plans to add more electric tools to sell in a store. Daniel will use the profits from the business to build a house. In the future, he dreams to have more capital compared to what he has right now.

loans.use: to buy more electric tools to sell

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 52 years old and married with 5 children.

Carmencita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

Carmencita has borrowed and paid back 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 8 years and also earns an income from selling bananas and ready-to-wear clothing.

Carmencita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, en su entorno se encuentran entre grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas viejas unas y modernas construcciones otras, que sin tener el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional le dan variedad al paisaje. Su gente mantiene las tradiciones y cultura de sus pueblos y se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles y muy carismáticas.

Doña María tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 6 hijos de los que cuatro son casados y viven independientes, sus dos últimos hijos tienen 18 y 14 años y estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo trabaja como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
La Señora. María es comerciante de animales, se dedica a la venta y cría de cuyes, cerdos y gallinas desde hace 20 años y trabaja en esta actividad solo días de ferias.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 15 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de gallinas, cerdos y cuyes para crecer en su negocio.
 
Su meta es crecer en el negocio.
texts.en:
María is a member of the 'Barrio Sucre' community bank.  She lives in Cumbe parish, in Cuenca, which is surrounded by large tracts of pasture land belonging to cattle farms.  There are old ranches and modern buildings which don't have the charm of traditional architecture but which provide the landscape with variety.  The local people keep the traditions and cultures of their villages alive and are noted for being friendly, kind and very charming people.

María is 48 years old, married, and has six children from her marriage.  Four of her children are married and live independently.  Her two youngest children are 18 and 14 years old and attend a high school in the city.  Her husband works as a builder.  They own the house in which they live.

María is an animal trader who has been selling and raising guinea pigs, pigs and hens for the past 20 years.  She only works in this business on market days.  She has been a member of her community bank for 15 years and she will invest her new loan in buying hens, pigs and guinea pigs to grow her business.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy hens, pigs and guinea pigs

loans.name: Bwumvikane

texts.en: Bwumvikane is 35 years old. He has 2 children aged between 6 months and 5 years old. He takes care of one child. He has been running a salon for the last 8 years. He wants a loan to buy more salon equipment to use. He plans to use the profits to building a house.

loans.use: to buy more salon equipment to use in the salon.

loans.name: Aloys

texts.en:
Aloys is 28 years and single. He sells bed sheets and bed covers. He has spent 4 years in the business. 

He wants this loan to buy more bed sheets and bed covers to sell. The profits will be used to build his house because currently he doesn’t have his own house.

loans.use: to buy more bed sheets and bed covers to sell.

loans.name: Ayub

texts.ru: Аюв девяти летний клиент в организации.У него трое сыновей, из которых один на заработках в  Российской Федерации. За годы кредитования он смог расширить семейный бизнес. Скотоводством занимается его сын, из-за возроста отца, а  закупом скота занимается сам Аюб. Его сын каждое утро выводит коров на пастбище ,а вечером загоняет и кормит их сеном  и кормом. Аюб с молодости увлекается откормом скота, чему и научил своих сыновей. У Аюба девять внуков, он жизнерадостный дедушка.Его жена домохозяйка, она занимается с невестками производством козьей пряжи и отсылают сыну в Российскую Федерацию, для продажи, т.к там пользуется большим спросом. В сезон пока скот дешёвый на рынке Аюб хочет на очередной займ купить пару  дойных коров.
texts.en:
Ayub has been a client in the organization for nine years. He has three sons, one of whom is currently working in Russia. Ayub managed to expand the family business over the years. Despite his age Ayub still buys the livestock, but it is his son who raises the animals. Every morning Ayub's son takes the cows out to pasture, and in the evening he brings the animals back to the pen and gives them hay and feed. Ayub was interested in livestock fattening from an early age, and that's what he taught his sons. 
Ayub has nine grandchildren, and he is a lively grandfather. His wife is a homemaker. Together with her daughters-in-law, she produces goat yarn and sends it over to Russia for her son to sell since it is in high demand there.  Ayub would like to take another loan to buy a couple of dairy cows while the market prices for the animals are low.

loans.use: to purchase two cows

loans.name: Abdukayum

texts.ru: Абдукаюм мужчина по специальности строитель, который занимается в свободное время откормом скота, а в сезон, когда цены на скот повышаются он продаёт их и получает доход. Он узнав от своих братьев, что можно получив кредит купить скот, решил тоже попробовать увеличить свой бизнес. Он планирует купить три молодых бычка и откормив продать в сезон за хорошую цену. Получаемый доход Абдукаюм расходует на крупные расходы семьи, вот например недавно отремонтировал свою машину, а осенью выдал свою дочь замуж. Поэтому Абдукаюм благодарен всем инвесторам за поддержку и финансирование его бизнеса.
texts.en: Abdukayum is a construction worker who fattens cattle in his spare time. When cattle prices rise, he sells the animals and makes the profit. Abdukayum's brothers told him that it is possible to receive a loan to buy the cattle, so he decided to try to get a loan to expand his business. Abdukayum is planning on buying three young bulls. He wants to fatten them and then to sell for a high price. With his income, Abdukayum covers the major expenses of the family. For instance, he recently got his car fixed, and in the fall he arranged his daughter's wedding. Therefore, Abdukayum thanks all the investors for their support and the financing of his business.

loans.use: to purchase three young bulls

loans.name: Samba Boy

texts.fr: Samba est un homme qui pratique l'activité d'élevage depuis sa tendre enfance.Il a gardé les chèvres étant tout petit avant de s'occuper des vaches lorsqu'il est devenu plus grand. Aujourd'hui, il est marié à deux femmes et est père de 4 enfants qui vont tous à l'école.Il pratique toujours l'élevage mais a adopté l'embouche bovine qu'il juge plus rentable. Il achète ainsi à bas prix des bœufs dans les grands marchés hebdomadaires du pays , les engraisse pendant 8 mois et les revend à un bon prix.Les revenus générés par cette activité lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de ses femmes et des ses enfants.Afin de renouveler son opération d'embauche, il sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un pret de 500000f pour acheter 2 bœufs. Son ambition est de continuer à renforcer son activité.
texts.en: Samba is a man who has been raising animals since his early childhood. He looked after goats when he was very young before taking care of cows when he was older. Today he is married to two women and is father to four children who all attend school. He still raises animals but has turned to fattening up oxen which he considers to be more profitable. He buys oxen at low prices at the large weekly country markets, then fattens them up for eight months and sells them for a good price. The income he generates from this business enables him to provide for his wives' needs as well as those of his children. He is requesting a loan of 500,000 francs from UIMCEC in order to renew his fattening activity and buy two oxen. His ambition is to continue strengthening his business.

loans.use: to buy two oxen

loans.name: Wilquer

texts.es:
Wilquer, de 33 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso. Convive con Mirtha quien es comerciante y madre de sus 04 hijos.  Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Wilquer es la venta de pescado fresco, es así que cada día se  levanta muy temprano en la madrugada. Se dirige al puerto de su localidad y compra los pescados frescos de diversa variedad para venderlos en ese instante al por mayor a los comerciantes en el mercado. Tiene más de 06 meses dedicándose a éste negocio. Por otro lado al término de su faena, también se dedica al servicio de transporte en su mototaxi, y ya tiene más de 06 años con ese oficio. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico, pues tenía tiempo buscando empleo sin conseguir nada. Hoy considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y hacerlo crecer invirtiendo mayor capital en la venta de pescado. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, comenta gustarle el trabajo de su banco comunal porque están apoyando a las personas en progresar.
Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería para su negocio como pescado fresco de diversas variedades.
texts.en:
33-year-old Wilquer is a hard-working and determined man.  He lives with Mirtha who is a saleswoman and the mother of his four children.  They live comfortably together in their own home.  Wilquer's business is selling fresh fish.  Every day he gets up very early in the morning and heads for the town port where he buys different varieties of fresh fish to sell wholesale to the traders in the market.  He has been in this business for more than six months.  When he has finished this work he provides a transport service with his motorcycle taxi.  He has been in this business for more than six years.  Wilquer enjoys his business because it makes him income and he had previously spent some time looking for a job without success.  He considers his business to be fairly profitable.  It makes him good profits.  For this reason, he has plans to expand his business and grow it by investing more capital in his fish sales.

This will be Wilquer's third loan from MFP and he hopes to receive your cooperation so that he can continue achieving his goals.  He says that he likes working with his community bank because they are supporting people and helping them to make progress.  Wilquer will invest the 1,500 soles he has requested in buying merchandise for his business.  He will buy different varieties of fresh fish.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish

loans.name: Ana Lourdes

texts.es:
La Señora Ana es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca,  en su entorno se encuentran entre grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas viejas unas y modernas construcciones otras, que sin tener el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional le dan variedad al paisaje. Su gente mantiene las tradiciones y cultura de sus pueblos y se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles y muy carismáticas.

La Señora Ana tiene 32 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 11, 9, 7 y 5 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en la escuela. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.
 
Doña Ana pasa su mayor de tiempo en casa al cuidado de sus hijos, también cría cerdos y cuyes. Trabaja en la agricultura, siembra hortalizas a las que las vende en su comunidad y también son para el consumo de su hogar.

En el banco comunal se encuentra en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y en alimento para sus animales.
 
Su meta es tener un criadero más grande de animales y que sus hijos tengan la mejor educación para que en un futuro sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana is a member of the communal bank "Barrio Sucre" and she lives in the Cumbe parish in Cuenca.  Here there are livestock farms with large pastures, and old and modern haciendas, which, while they do not have the charm of the traditional architecture, lend variety to the landscape.  The people maintain the local traditions and culture and are kind, gentle, and very charismatic.

Ana is 32, married and has four children, ages 11, 9, 7 and 5, who are all in school.  Her husband works as a bricklayer and they own the house they live in.

Ana spends most of her time taking care of the children and raising pigs and guinea pigs.  She also is involved in agriculture, growing vegetables which she sells in her community and also uses for home consumption.

The communal bank is on its second loan and she plans to use it to buy pigs and animal feed.

Her goal is to have a larger livestock business, and see that her children get the best education possible so they can become good professionals in the future.

loans.use: To buy pigs and animal feed.

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es:
La Señora Rosario es socia del banco comunal Barrio Sucre, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, en su entorno se encuentran entre grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas viejas unas y modernas construcciones otras, que sin tener el encanto de la arquitectura tradicional le dan variedad al paisaje. Su gente mantiene las tradiciones y cultura de sus pueblos y se caracterizan por ser personas amables, gentiles y muy carismáticas.
