Doña Rosario tiene 56 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Rosario se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y como pasa en casa cría  ganado, cuyes, borregos, gallinas y conejos a los que los vende en su comunidad. También trabaja en la agricultura, sus cosechas son solo para el consumo de su hogar.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 14 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra abono para mejorar sus potreros.
 
Su meta es realizar una vereda en su casa.
texts.en:
Rosario is a member of the 'Barrio Sucre' community bank.  She lives in Cumbe parish, in Cuenca, which is surrounded by large tracts of pasture land belonging to cattle farms.  There is a mixture of old ranches and modern buildings.  The modern buildings don't have the charm of the traditional architecture but they provide the landscape with some variety.  The local people keep the traditions and culture of their villages alive and they are noted for being kind, friendly and very charming people.

Rosario is 56 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage.  Her children are all adults, married, and living independently.  Her husband works as a builder and they own their own home.

Rosario takes care of her housework and, as she is at home, she raises cattle, guinea pigs, lambs, hens and rabbits which she sells in her community.  She also farms.  Her harvests are for her family's consumption.

Rosario has been a member of her community bank for 14 years and she will invest her new loan in buying fertilizer to improve her fields.  Her goal is to lay paving in her yard.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Ludgarda

texts.es:
Ludgarda, de 57 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser alegre y cordial. Está casada con Robinson quien se dedica al comercio y es padre de sus 06 hijos. Juntos habitan cómodamente en compañía de sus 5 nietos y su nuera. La actividad que realiza Ludgarda, es la venta de ropa de segundo uso para damas, caballeros y niños. Adquiere estos productos en los centros comerciales de la localidad y  los vende en zonas alejadas, por los caseríos, pueblos jóvenes y asentamientos humanos. Atendiendo de manera amable y cordial a sus clientes. Además de la continuidad ha logrado hacerse muy conocida. Tiene más de 28 años dedicándose éste negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos y poder contar con un oficio, además de gustarle el comercio y el trato con las personas. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto tiene planes de continuar y además abrir otro negocio como una bodega de abarrotes en su casa. Este sería el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además se siente bien el trabajo que viene realizando el banco comunal apoyando a las personas a progresar.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías como ropa de segundo uso de diversas variedades, buscando precios más bajos por su compra en volumen.
texts.en:
57-year-old Ludgarda is a hard-working and determined woman who is also cheerful and friendly.  She is married to Robinson who is a salesman and the father of her six children.  They live comfortably together with their five grandchildren and daughter-in-law.

Ludgarda's business is selling used clothing for ladies, men and children.  She acquires her products in the shopping centers in her town and then sells them in remote areas, in small villages, shanty towns and squatter settlements.  She serves her customers in a kind and friendly manner and has become very well known.  Ludgarda has been working in this business for more than 28 years and, up to now, she has worked alone.  She likes her business because it makes her income and gives her a trade.  She also likes selling and dealing with people.  She considers her business to be profitable and it does make her good profits.  For this reason, she has plans to continue in her business and, in addition, to open another business such as a grocery store in her home. 

This will be Ludgarda's second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive your cooperation so that she can carry out her plans.  She is happy with the work of her community bank which supports people who want to make progress.  Ludgarda will invest the 1,000 soles she has requested in buying merchandise (different types of used clothing).  She will obtain lower prices as she will be buying in bulk.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing

loans.name: Catherine

texts.es: Catherine, de 34 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Wilter quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es padre de sus 03 hijos. Juntos habitan en su casa propia en compañía de su papá y mamá. La actividad que realiza Catherine es la venta de bebidas gaseosas y refrescos preparados con frutas de la selva de deliciosos sabores. Posee una refrigeradora donde guarda y congela sus productos a la temperatura que es del agrado de sus clientes, a quienes atiende desde su casa de manera amable y cordial ganándose su preferencia. Tiene más de 03 años dedicándose a éste oficio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su hija en la atención. Le gusta su negocio por los ingresos económicos que le genera, además de poder estar en la comodidad de su casa y atender a sus hijos a quienes quiere mucho. Considera su negocio rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por eso, tiene planes de continuar, y además incursionar en otro negocio que sería la venta de comida rápida como pollos broaster. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP. Está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como gaseosas de diversos sabores y marcas, así como frutas para la preparación de refrescos.
texts.en:
Catherine, 34, is a hard-working, enterprising woman who is determined to get ahead.  She lives with Wilter who works in the building industry and is the father of her three children.  They live in their own house with her mother and father.  Catherine sells sodas and soft drinks make from jungle fruit in delicious flavors.  She has a refrigerator where she keeps her products cold for the customers.  She attends to them in her home in a kind and cordial manner which gains their loyalty.

for over three years she has been in business and she counts on the support of her daughter who helps serve customers.  She enjoys the business because of the economic income it generates, and because of being able to work from home where he can care for her loving children.  She believes her business is profitable and so is planning to continue.  She also wants to go into the fast food business and sell broasted chicken.  

This will be her 10th loan through the MFP institution.  She is very happy about receiving financial support since this makes her feel safe about advancing further in the business.  The 1,000 PEN loan will be used to buy merchandise such as different flavors and brands of sodas, as well as fruit to make softdrinks.

loans.use: To buy sodas and fruit.

loans.name: Kiria

texts.es: Kiria, de 36 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Flaubert quien es policía y padre de sus dos hijos de 9 y 4 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Kiria es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad para esto cuenta con una bodega que instaló en su casa, atendiendo amablemente a sus clientes que en su mayoría son sus vecinos con quienes ha logrado hacer amistad y ganarse sus preferencias. Tiene más de 1 año dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento lo realiza ella sola. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera un ingreso económico para apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, además de estar en la comodidad de su casa y tener tiempo disponible para dedicarlo a otras actividades. Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por  la demanda y las ganancias que le deja. Por tanto, tiene planes de seguir con su negocio y hacerlo crecer, además de complementar su negocio con una librería ya que por la zona no hay. Este será el préstamo número 10 con la institución MFP. Por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta estar a gusto con su banco comunal pues conoce a sus integrantes y los considera ser personas responsables y solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1,700 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como abarrotes en variedad para tener un stock y disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Kiria, 36, is a hard-working woman who is determined to get ahead.  She lives with Flaubert who is a policeman and the father of her two children, aged 9 and 4.  They live comfortably in their own home.  Kiria sells daily consumption groceries for a living and has a store set up in her house.  She attends to her customers with kindness.  Most of them are neighbors who have become friends and are loyal to her store.  She has been in business for over a year and for the time being works alone.

She enjoys her business because of the income it generates which she uses to help her husband cover household expenses.  It is also comfortable to work from home and have time to spend on other activities.  She feels the business is quite good because of its popularity and profits.  So she is planning to continue with the store and even expand it, and also open a bookstore because there is none in the area.  This is her 10th loan through the MFP institutition.  She is counting on your collaboration so she can follow through with her plans. 

She is happy with her communal bank because she knows all the members and considers them to be responsible, supportive people.  The 1,700 PEN loan will be used to buy a variety of groceries to restock her store.

loans.use: To buy products for her store.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny, de 26 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, con muchas ganas de progresar. Convive con Richard quien es comerciante y padre de sus hijos de 8, 3 y 1 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Jenny es la venta de bebidas gaseosas  contando con un local propio habilitado en su propia casa, donde tiene una refrigeradora donde almacena la gaseosa a temperatura helada al gusto de sus clientes. Así logra ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes, quienes la recomiendan con otras personas, ellos con el tiempo se vuelven en sus clientes habituales. Tiene más de 1 año dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de una persona en la atención a los clientes.  Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos, además de contar con un oficio y sentirse una persona productiva. Por tanto, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, e incursionar en otro negocio, como el alquiler de cuartos. Este será el préstamo número 2 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos.  Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de gaseosas para su negocio.
texts.en:
26-year-old Jenny is a hard-working and determined woman who has a great desire to make progress.  She lives with Richard who is a salesman and the father of her children who are 8, 3 and 1 year(s) old.  They live together in their own home that they worked hard to buy.  

Jenny's business is selling soda.  She has premises in her own home where she has a refrigerator which keeps the soda chilled as this is how her customers like it.  She has managed to gain the loyalty of her customers who recommend her to other people and, over time, they become regulars.  Jenny has been in this business for more than a year and, up to now, she has had the support of one other person in serving her customers.  She enjoys her business because it makes her income, gives her a trade, and makes her feel like a productive person.  For this reason, she plans to expand her business and start out in another business such as renting rooms.

This will be Jenny's second loan from MFP and she hopes to receive a small loan so that she can achieve her goals.  She will invest the 1,200 soles she has requested in buying soda for her business.

loans.use: to buy soda

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 41 years old and married with 4 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to build a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy feeds, medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Balikyegomba Kikonge Group

texts.en:
Jane is 45 years old and operates a textile business in Kagadi, Uganda. She has run this business for 10 years now. She started as a shop attendant where she saved her monthly earnings and set up her business. Her business is affected by price fluctuations and inflation. She hopes to expand her business into new trading centers.

Jane is a member of Balikyegomba Kikonge, a village group where members guarantee each other in accessing loans. She wants the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Delsa

texts.en: Delsa works hard to support her family. She is married and has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Delsa requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her tailoring business. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Speratha

texts.en: Speratha is 39 years old. She has 5 children between the ages of 3 and 14. Four of them attend school. She has been selling foodstuffs for the last 5 years. She will use the loan to buy more foodstuffs, such as potatoes, bananas and sweet potatoes. She plans to use the profits to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Edna works hard to support her family. She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. 

Edna is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more blouses, pants, shoes and other clothing for her clothing sales business. She has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more blouses, pants, shoes and other clothing.

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia, de 30 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de ser amable y cordial tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Henry quien se dedica al transporte y es padre de sus 4 hijos de 15, 14, 10 y 4 años de edad. Juntos habitan cómodamente en su propia casa. La actividad que desea iniciar Sofía es la venta de verduras frescas de diversas variedades. Cuenta con una furgoneta para el transporte, realizará sus ventas de manera ambulante por zonas alejadas como asentamientos humanos. Proponiéndose brindar una buena atención y ganarse la preferencia de sus clientes. Hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien será quien la transportará. Le gusta el negocio pues genera un ingreso económico y contar  con un oficio sintiéndose una persona productiva ya que no podía conseguir un empleo. Considera éste negocio rentable por las ganancias que deja por tanto tiene planes de trabajar arduo y hacerlo crecer. Este será el préstamo número 04 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado, comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal pues lo considera un grupo unido y solidario.
Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería como verduras para la venta, buscará los precios más bajos para que pueda comprar en volumen.
texts.en:
Sofia, 30, is a hard-working, enterprising woman who, apart from being kind and cordial, is very determined to get ahead.  She lives with Henry who is in the transportation business and the father of her four children, ages 15, 14, 10 and 4.  They live comfortably in their own house.  Sofia sells different varieties of fresh vegetables.  She has a van that she uses to sell in areas far from the villages.  She makes an effort to provide good customer service in an aim to gain the loyalty of her customers.

To date, she has been able to count on her husband for transportation.  She enjoys the business because in addition to giving her an income it makes her feel productive, since she was unable to get a job.  She believes the business is good because of the profit it generates, so she plans to work hard and expand it.

This is her fourth loan through the MFP institution and she is counting on your collaboration to follow through with her plans.  Also, she feels good about her communal bank because she feels it is a very united, supportive group.

The 1,000 PEN loan will be used to buy merchandise such as vegetables.  She will look for the lowest prices so she can buy bulk items.

loans.use: To buy vegetables.

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilú, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora empeñosa, con muchas ganas de salir adelante. Convive con Javier quien se dedica a la construcción civil y es padre de sus 03 hijos de 18, 15 y 4 años de edad. Juntos habitan en su propia casa que compraron con mucho esfuerzo. La actividad que realiza Marilú es el alquiler de cuartos para parejas y personas solteras, contando hasta éste momento con 05 habitaciones ocupadas. Su casa es muy amplia y con la iniciativa de su esposo emprendió éste negocio. Tiene más de 10 años dedicándose al trabajo  y hasta el momento cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien el ayuda a conseguir nuevos inquilinos. Le gusta lo que hace pues le genera ingresos económicos, y le permite tener una ocupación para sentirse una persona productiva brindándole un apoyo a su pareja con los gastos de su hogar.  Considera a su negocio bastante rentable por la demanda que tiene ya que todos sus cuartos están ocupados. Por tanto, tiene planes de habilitar más cuartos y convertirlo en un hospedaje. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para los arreglos de las habitaciones y construir al menos 02 habitaciones y ponerlos en alquiler.
texts.en:
42-year-old Marilú is a hard-working and determined woman who has a great desire to do well in life.  She lives with Javier who works as a civil engineer.  He is also the father of her three children who are 18, 15 and 4 years old.  They live together in their own home which they worked hard to buy.

Marilú's business is renting out rooms to couples and single people.  She has five occupied rooms.  Her house is very big and she started this business at her husband's suggestion.  She has been in this business for more than 10 years and, up to now, she has had the support of her husband who helps her to acquire new tenants.  She likes what she does because it makes her income, makes her feel like a productive person and enables her to support her husband with the household expenses.  She considers her business to be profitable because of the demand she has and the fact that all of her rooms are occupied.  For this reason, she plans to do up more rooms and turn her home into a boarding house.

This will be Marilú's third loan from MFP.  She is happy to know that she will have financial support as it will make her feel secure in making progress in her business.  She will invest the 1,200 soles she has requested in buying materials with which to do up her rooms and in building at least two more rooms to put up for rent.

loans.use: to buy materials to do up some rooms

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in Yei. She is a food stall seller, and has been in business for five years. She is 30 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are still in school. 

Jane heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for resale.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John used the previous loan to pay school fees for his children. However, in his agricultural sector he faces a challenge of seasonal weather, especially at this time when we have had a prolonged dry season. He maintains his dream of educating his children and buying land to grow crops. John needs the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en: Anne is 51 years old and the mother of 7 children. She does maize farming to earn a living. She has been in the business for 9 years and has employed two people. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 20,000 Kenya Shillings to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Heshle

texts.en:
Heshle is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a variety store business in the Philippines.She has been in this business for 8 years. She earns more income from hog raising.

Heshle has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her store.  She wants to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more items like shampoo, groceries etc. to sell in her store.

loans.name: Melissa

texts.es:
Melissa, de 21 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora dedicada, además de ser amable y cordial tiene muchas ganas de progresar. Convive con Ricardo quien es comerciante y padre de su hija de 2 años de edad. Juntos habitan en la casa de su suegra. La actividad que realiza Melissa es la venta de mercadería variada como ropa, víveres, utensilios, entre otros. Todos estos productos los compra al por mayor  en los centros comerciales y los vende entre los comerciantes al menudeo  brindado créditos con un pago mínimo diario. Se inició en éste negocio por iniciativa de su suegra quien le dio el capital y cartera de clientes. Tiene más de 2 años dedicándose a éste negocio y hasta el momento lo continúa haciendo sola.
Le gusta lo que hace, pues así se convierte en una mujer independiente, ahora lo que más desea es convertirse en una prospera empresaria. Considera su negocio bastante rentable por las buenas ganancias que le deja. Por tanto, tiene planes de abrir un local comercial en la casa de su suegra y exhibir su variada mercadería. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además comenta sentirse bien con su banco comunal, pues le gusta el trabajo que vienen realizando brindando oportunidades a las personas. Con el monto solicitado de 1,500 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mercaderías para tener un stock disponible para la venta.
texts.en:
Melissa, 21, is a dedicated, hard-working woman who, in addition to being kind and cordial, is very determined to get ahead.  She lives with Ricardo who is a merchant and the father of her 2-year-old daughter.  They live with her mother-in-law.  Melissa sells varied merchandise such as clothing, groceries, and utensils, among other items.  She buys all her products wholesale at the shopping centers and sells them retail and on a credit basis, with a minimum daily payment.  

She started the business with the encouragement of her mother-in-law who gave her the capital and list of customers. For over two years she has been in business and, for now, continues to work alone.

She enjoys what she does because she can become an independent woman.  What she wants most is to become a prosperous business woman.  She feels the business is good because of the high profits it generates.  She wants to open a shop in her mother-in-law's house so she can display the varied merchandise.  This is her third loan through the MFP institution and she is counting on your collaboration so she can follow through with her plans.  She is comfortable in her communal bank because she likes the fact that it gives people opportunities.  The 1,500 PEN loan will be used to buy merchandise to restock her business.

loans.use: To buy clothing, groceries and utensils.

loans.name: Gongo La Mboto One Group

texts.en:
Rehema, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children, one of whom goes to school while the other one is too young. She has been selling powdered soap and bar soap for two years now. She works from 9.00 am to 6.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase her business and has repaid her loan successfully. She wants a loan to increase her supply of powdered soap and to buy more bars of soap. Her dream is to one day be able to have a poultry business.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Gongo La Mboto One" which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to buy powdered soap and more bars of soap.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice has a common-law husband with 3 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 45 years old and one of her children is in school. She has a used clothing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 12 years. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell. In the future, Alice would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Sagrado Corazón Del Junco (Bahia De Caraquez) Group

texts.es:
En un sitio llamado el Junco de la ciudad de Bahía de Caraquez Provincia de Manabí, se reúne cada 15 días las 26 socias del Banco Comunal Sagrado Corazón del Junco. Las mismas que se dedican a la agricultura y cría de animales en su gran mayoría. Ellas hace dos años  atrás  decidieron unirse  para  poder acceder a los créditos que brinda La Fundación Espoir con los cuales han podido mejorar su situación económica.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Sonia, tiene 40 años,  está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de 16, 13 y 4  años de edad, los dos  mayores  estudian en colegio. El marido es agricultor.
 
Ella junto con su esposo se dedican a la  agricultura, en temporadas de invierno siembran maíz, maní y ciertas legumbres, también tienen cultivos de maracuyá, la misma que la cultivan en toda época del año por ser cultivos de ciclo largo, ellos por el momento están dedicados de lleno a los cultivos de maíz y maní ya que son los que requieren de mayor cuidado por las plagas, es por eso que han solicitado el crédito para comprar insecticidas y fertilizantes para tener una mejor producción, trabajan de lunes a viernes de 07h00 hasta las 15h00. En verano más se dedican a la producción de maracuyá las mismas que recolectan y llevan a entregar a  los distintos mercados de la ciudad.
 
Este crédito es para comprar fertilizantes e insecticidas. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que les han dado con los créditos para salir adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener una muy buena producción y salud ante todo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 26 members of the 'Sagrado Corazón del Junco' community bank meet in El Junco, in the city of Bahía de Caraquez, in Manabí province.  The group's members mainly work in farming and livestock raising.  Two years ago they decided to come together so that they could access loans from Fundación Espoir.  They have used these loans to improve their financial situation.

One of the members of this group is Sonia.  She is 40 years old, married, and has three children who are 16, 13 and 4 years old.  Her two oldest children are in high school.  Her husband is a farmer.

Sonia and her husband both farm.  During the winter season they grow corn, peanuts and certain vegetables.  They also grow passion fruit year round as these are  long-cycle crops.  Right now they are focusing on their corn and peanut crops as they require the most protection from pests.  They have requested this loan to buy insecticides and fertilizers so that they can enjoy a better production.  They work from Monday to Friday, from 7.00am to 3.00pm.  In the summer they focus more on producing passion fruit which they pick and then deliver to different markets in the city.

This loan will be used to buy fertilizers and insecticides.  Sonia has been a member of her community bank from the beginning and she likes it because of the help that they have given her to make progress through loans.

Sonia's dream is to enjoy a very good production and, above all, good health.

loans.use: to buy insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Del Piro'y Group

texts.es:
El comité se denomina Mujeres Unidas del Piro`y, están en el Segundo Ciclo con 11  integrantes. Es un grupo muy unido, solidario y responsable, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, realizan actividades de recaudación de fondos, como también de motivación, y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento de responsabilidad con la institución.
Justa es una de las integrantes del grupo, es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, nos cuenta que desde joven ha trabajado y que no teme a los desafíos. Ella se dedica a la costura, y gracias a su trabajo ha podido ayudar siempre a su familia con los gastos que surgen día a día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de telas e hilos, con lo cual podrá seguir trabajando y a la vez creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
The committee is called Mujeres Unidas del Piro and they are in their second cycle with 11 members. It is a very united, supportive and responsible group. The members have a great entrepreneurial spirit and are up to date on their payments. They do fundraising and motivational activities and intend to finish this stage being responsible with the institution.    

Justa is one of the members of the group. She is a hardworking and a fighter. She tells us that sine she was young she has worked and she is not afraid of challenges. She sews, and thanks to her work she has been able to always help her family with the expenses that come up day to day.

She is asking for the loan to buy fabric and thread with which she will continue to work and at the same time grow her business.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread.

loans.name: Kuña Aty Kyre'y Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formo en la ciudad de Caaguazú, son señoras emprendedoras que luchan día a día para salir adelante y forman un grupo de 17 sras. con la intención de  obtener una ayuda para continuar trabajando y así mantener a la familia. Están actualmente en el 3er. ciclo y se esfuerzan al máximo.
Gabriela nos comenta que todos los días empieza a trabajar desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana. Ella tiene una modesta despensa bien surtida, con la que abastece a sus vecinos, ella se ha propuesto trabajar para que de esa forma pueda ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de comestibles, bebidas, lácteos y demás, con lo que podrá abastecer su local y tener más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This committee was formed in the city of Caaguazú. They are enterprising women who fight day to day to get ahead. They are a group of 17 women who intend to get a little help to continue working and thus support their children. Right now they are in the 3rd cycle and they work as hard as they can.  

Gabriela tells us that every day she starts to work very early in the morning. She has a modest, well stocked store where she serves her neighbors. She has decided to work this way so that she can help her family.   

She is asking for the loan to buy food, beverages, dairy and more to stock her locale and have more variety to offer her customers.

loans.use: to buy beverages, food, dairy and more.

loans.name: Po Yoapy Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de  Caaguazú, se reunieron 14 señoras para formar un comité de mujeres financiado por la Fundación Paraguaya; Están actualmente en el 1er. ciclo y ellas nos cuentan que se encuentran muy entusiasmadas con esto y que pondrán su mayor esfuerzo.
Fidelina es una mujer muy trabajadora, y nos cuenta que tiene una despensa bien surtida, dice que le ha costado mucho trabajo salir adelante, pero que por medio de su esfuerzo y su arduo trabajo lo ha podido hacer. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo con su negocio, para que de esa forma pueda seguir ayudando en la casa.
Ella solicita el crédito, para abastecer su negocio con artículos de primera necesidad, como ser azúcar, pan, fideos, arroz, y demás.
texts.en:
In the city of Caaguazú, 14 ladies came together to form a women's committee, financed by Fundación Paraguaya.  They are currently in their first loan cycle and tell us that they are very keen and will put in their very best efforts.

Fidelina is a very hard-working woman who tells us that she has a well-stocked grocery store.  She says that it has been very hard work making progress but she has put in a lot of effort and hard work and has managed.  Her goal is to continue growing her business so that she can continue helping her household.

Fidelina is requesting this loan to stock her business with basic household products such as sugar, bread, noodles, rice, etc.

loans.use: to buy sugar, bread, noodles, rice, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to sell more milk, sodas, water and vouchers.

loans.name: Familia Unida 2 Group

texts.es:
Unidas y confiadas en sí mismas formaron un grupo, señoras de la ciudad de Caaguazú, esperanzadas en que podrían alcanzar sus metas y con el gran apoyo de la Fundación Paraguaya  podrían  lograrlo. Es un comité con 15  señoras humildes y trabajadoras, quienes se encuentran en el primer ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la fundación.
Lidia es una mujer muy entusiasta y con muchas ganas de progresar y salir adelante, nos comenta que se dedica a la venta de comidas de todo tipo, y nos dice que gracias a Dios le va muy bien, puesto que tiene muy buenos platos que gustan a sus clientes.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carne, verduras, condimentos, fideos y demás insumos que necesita para poder seguir vendiendo los platillos que hace. Agradece a kiva y a la fundación por la oportunidad que reciben ella y sus amigas.
texts.en:
United and with confidence in themselves, women from the city of Caaguazú formed a group, in the hope that they can reach their goals, and that with the great help of the Paraguaya Foundation they will be able to achieve this. It is a committee of 15 humble and hard-working women, who are in their first loan cycle in the Foundation's program for entrepreneurial women. 

Lidia is a very enthusiastic woman with a great desire to make progress and get ahead. She comments that she works selling food of all kinds, and she says that "thanks to God" it is going very well for her, since she has many good dishes which her customers like. 

She is requesting the loan to buy meat, vegetables, noodles, condiments and other supplies that she needs so that she can keep selling the dishes she makes. She is grateful to Kiva and the Foundation for the opportunity she and her friends are receiving.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, noodles, condiments and other supplies.

loans.name: Abdujabbor

texts.ru: Абдужаббор проживает в районе Хуросон. Ему 40 лет. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он занимается животноводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается пять лет. Кредит берет для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Abdujabbor lives in the Khuroson area. He is 40 years old, married, and has four children. Abdujabbor raises cattle. He has been doing this for five years. He is requesting a loan to buy calves.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Hammer

texts.es:
Hammer de 19 años es un joven soltero y muy dinámico. Vive con sus padres y sus 2 hermanos. Él y su familia viven en una casa propia en la localidad de Cayán, distrito de Huasahuasi, provincia de Tarma. Hammer, a pesar de su edad, ya es un hombre trabajador. En los terrenos de sus padres siembra productos como: papas, arvejas y maíz. 
Terminó con éxito sus estudios secundarios y se dedicó al trabajo del campo apoyando incondicionalmente a su padre. Pero en sus metas está estudiar una carrera profesional o técnica, para ello se esfuerza por que ya quiere ser un hombre independiente.
Siembra alrededor de 40 sacos de semillas de papa al año y 4 bolsas de semillas de arveja. Su producción es abundante y logra vender con satisfacción en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, cuyos compradores llevan la mercadería hacia distintas ciudades del país, como son Lima, Arequipa, Ica y otras ubicadas en la costa del Perú.
Hammer tiene claras sus metas y prioridades, por eso deja en un segundo plano formar una familia y tener hijos. Su realización personal es primero. Éste sería su préstamo número 5 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. “Siempre Juntos”, es el nombre de su banco comunal del que se siente contento y a gusto por el respaldo de personas solidarias.
Invertirá el dinero del crédito en la compra de bolsas de abonos orgánicos y semillas de arvejas, para iniciar otra seimbra.
texts.en:
Hammer is 19 and is a very dynamic and single young person. He lives with his parents and 2 siblings in their own home in Cayán, Huasahuasi district, Tarma Province. In spite of his age, Hammer is very hard-working. In his father's fields he tends crops such as potatoes, corn and beans. 
After successfully finishing his studies, he began to help his father full time. He still hopes to study a technical or professional field, and through his own efforts hopes to become an independent man.
He plants about 40 bags of potato seed annually and 4 bags of bean seed, yielding abundant production.  He is able to sell in the wholesale market of Tarma, whose buyers take the produce to other major markets in Lima, Arequipa, Ica and other cities of coastal Perú.
Hammer is clear in his goals and priorities and plans to have a family.  He places his self-development first. This will be his 5th loan from MFP, and he is committed to prompt repayment. “Siempre Juntos”, is the name of his communal lender and he is very content to have the support of others.
He will invest these funds in buying sacks of organic fertilizer and bean seed stock, for the next harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer sacks and bean seed stock.

loans.name: Chamreoun

texts.en:
Chamreoun, age 45, is married and resides with her husband and four children in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She has been selling groceries for more than six years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately $5 per day. One of Chamreoun's children is employed in a shoe factory. 

In order to improve her family's living conditions, Chamreoun is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase construction materials to build a new house. In doing so, her family would be able to live in a comfortable house. In the future, she would like to expand her grocery store, build a fence around her house and support her children in their studies so they can earn bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a new house.

loans.name: Virgencita

texts.en:
Virgencita, age 44, is married and has three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Virgencita has a business selling home products in the Philippines. Virgencita has requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more home products to sell.

Virgencita has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Virgencita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more home products to sell.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past five years, Florence has been working hard to manage her small business, which involves stone quarrying. 

To help expand her business, Florence has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to hire workers and buy some materials to use in her stone quarrying business. This will help Florence generate greater profits and enable her to buy food for her family. Florence hopes that in the future she will be able to own a retail shop. 

Florence is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to micro-finance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Florence's future prospects by helping her improve her business.

loans.use: to hire workers and buy some materials to use in her stone quarrying business.

loans.name: Emidia

texts.es:
La señora Emidia tiene 41 años de edad, tiene un pequeño puesto de ventas de comestibles y bebidas en el mercado municipal de su ciudad, había iniciado el negocio hace más de un año, vendiendo primeramente empanadas y gaseosas, actualmente además de otras minutas, prepara comidas para el almuerzo como guisos y tallarines. Tienen dos hijos adolescentes estudiantes uno de 19 años y otro de 21 años, y nos cuenta que su esposo es policía.
Ella comenta que gracias a este puesto ella ha podido ayudar a su marido con los gastos de la casa, y de esa forma hacer un poco más ligera la carga. Ella desea poder seguir creciendo y es por ello que solicita el crédito, para la compra de bebidas, como ser: cervezas, gaseosas, jugos, etc.lo cual le servirá para poder surtir su negocio. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, de poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Emidia is 41 and has a small stand of food and drinks in the municipal market of her city.  She started this business a year ago, selling empanadas and soft drinks, and now offers other snacks, preparing dishes for lunch such as soups and pasta. She supports two adolescents who are students, aged 19 and 21, and her husband works as a policeman.
Emidia is pleased that her sales help with household expenses and lighten her and her husband's financial burdens.  She seeks to grow her business and for this reason seeks credit to buy stock of drinks such as beer, soft drinks, juices, etc. to expand the variety of her store.  She is very grateful for this opportunity to continue her work.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She is a food stall seller, and she has been in this business for two years. Charity, age 30, is married and has five children, two of whom are still in school. 

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale.

loans.name: Lay Houy

texts.en:
Lay Houy, age 53, is married and resides with her husband and four children in the Takeo province of Cambodia. She and her husband have been growing agricultural crops for more than 20 years, earning approximately $3 per day. Additionally, her husband is a construction worker who earns approximately $5 per day. All of her children are employed at a factory. 

Due to the lack of cattle, Lay Houy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase cattle to use for farming. In the future, she hopes her husband will become a construction foreman. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to buy cattle for farming.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en: Harriet is a forty-seven-year-old married woman with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. Her personal goal is to educate her children, build a permanent house and buy a car. She has been operating a retail shop for five years and her major hardships are high transportation costs and inadequate capital to purchase stock, however, she has a vision of diversifying her business to include farming, buying land to grow crops and hiring employees to help expand her business. Harriet needs the loan to buy sodas and detergents to sell.

loans.use: to buy sodas and detergents to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Yei. She is a food stall seller and has been in business for three years. She is 24 years old, married, and has two children; both of them are in school. 

Rose heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is 40 years old, married and a mother of six children. She operates a retail shop in Malindi town and has been in the business for the last seven years. She earns a monthly profit of 20,000 KES. 

She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and she is applying for her fifth loan of 95,000 KES. She intends to use the loan amount to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, cooking oil, cooking flour, some stationery for school children for sale in her business.


Loise will save the anticipated profit and help take care of her children. In the future, the lady hopes to continue growing her shop and also intends to venture into other investments.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as soft drinks, cooking oil, cooking flour

loans.name: Anite

texts.en:
Anite lives in Yei. She is a food stall seller and has been in business for two years. She is 32 years old, married, and has four children; two of them are still in school. 

Anite heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer and this is her second loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish  for sale.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr:
Kodjo est un homme âgé de 27 ans. Il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants.  
Kodjo travaille comme revendeur de matériels informatiques depuis 2005. Il a loué une boutique pour bien répondre à la demande de la cliente. Il vend seul et sa difficulté principale est la concurrence.
Kodjo a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des matériels informatiques. Il veut réinvestir dans l’activité.
Dans les prochaines années, Kodjo voudrait agrandir son commerce et plus tard avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Kodjo is a 27-year-old single man with no children. He has been working as a reseller of computer equipment since 2005. He leases a shop to better meet customer demand. He works alone. Kodjo feels that his main difficulty is the competition in his sector of business.

Kodjo is seeking his first loan from WAGES to purchase computer equipment. He plans to reinvest in his activity. In the coming years, he would like to expand his business and have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase computer equipment for resale.

loans.name: Katherin

texts.es:
La Sra. Katherin es soltera, ella tiene una despensa- mercería en su domicilio. Nos cuenta vive en casa de sus padres, y que gracias al trabajo que hace puede ayudar con los gastos de la casa.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora, nos comenta que le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que gracias a su trabajo y su dedicación ha podido crecer mucho y servir también a sus padres de ayuda. Su meta es poder seguir creciendo y convertirse en una gran microempresaria, lo cual sabe que podrá conseguir.
Ella acude a kiva y a la fundación para solicitar un crédito, lo cual invertirá en abastecer su negocio con bebidas, comestibles, prendas variadas y demás. Está muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le está dando.
texts.en: Katherin is single and runs a small store out of her home.  She lives with her parents, and thanks to her sales is able to contribute for household expenses.  She is very hard-working and enterprising, and enjoys her sales business very much, as it allows her to grow and help her family.  Her goal is to expand her store and convert it to a larger business.  She is confident she can do this.  She seeks this Kiva credit to stock her business with drinks, snacks, varied clothing and other items.  She is very grateful for the opportunity that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy drinks, snacks, varied clothing and other items.

loans.name: Teodocia

texts.es:
Teodocia de 49 años, es una mujer soltera. Tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 2, de 20 y 17 años. Ella y sus hijos viven en una casa propia en el distrito de Tarma. Teodocia es una mujer que trabaja con esmero. Gracias a su propio empeño pudo abrir un negocio en su propia casa. Ahí expende productos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, menestras, enlatados, bebidas, golosinas y otros. Pero, manifiesta que lograr comprar toda su mercadería le costó mucho esfuerzo y trabajo, ya que tenía que ahorrar cada mes. 
Y como si fuera poco, Teodocia prepara alimentos comida rápida, la que expende en las tardes y noches fuera de su bodega. “Las hamburguesas y salchipollos son rentables, por que las ventas son diarias”, afirma, añadiendo que, gracias a su ubicación (al lado de un complejo deportivo) sus productos son consumidos sin problemas.
Con el pasar del tiempo espera consolidar su negocio como un minimarket, en el que también ofrecerá artículos de belleza, joyas y perfumes. Teodocia lleva mucho tiempo trabajando con MFP, y estaría recibiendo su crédito número 13, gracias a su ayuda. Ella pertenece a un grupo unido y solidario “GS-006”, está contenta con el trabajo. Invertirá el dinero en la compra de mercadería para surtir su bodega. Su prioridad es adquirir bolsas de arroz, azúcar, latas de leche y conservas de pescados.
texts.en:
49-year-old Teodocia is a single mother.  She has five children but only lives with two of them (20 and 17 years old).  She and her children live in their own home in Tarma district.

Teodocia is a woman who carries out her work with great care.  Thanks to her determination, she was able to open a business in her own home.  There she sells basic household products such as groceries, vegetables, canned goods, drinks, candies, etc.  She says that buying all her merchandise took a lot of effort and hard work as she had to save up each month.  As if this wasn't enough, Teodocia also prepares fast food which she sells in the afternoons and evenings outside her store.  "Hamburgers and salchipollos are profitable because they sell every day", she says, adding that thanks to the location of her business (next to a sports complex) she sells all her food without problems.  Over time, Teodocia hopes to consolidate her business into a minimarket where she will also offer beauty products, jewelry and perfume.

Teodocia has been working with MFP for a long time and this will be her 13th loan thanks to your help.  She belongs to a united and supportive group called 'GS-006'.  She is happy with their work.  Teodocia will invest her money in buying merchandise with which to stock her store.  Her priority is acquiring bags of rice, sugar, cans of milk and canned fish.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar, cans of milk and canned fish

loans.name: Sebastian

texts.en:
Sebastian, a 41-year-old married father of three children living in Kasese, Uganda has been operating a pub for the last four years. Having started with capital of 1,500,000, his business is now worth 3,000,000 shillings.

Sebastian's biggest challenge is inadequate capital to meet customer demand, so he is now requesting a loan to purchase beers and sodas for resale. He has a vision of expanding and diversifying his business to include farming, and his personal goals are to educate his children and build a permanent house to live in.

loans.use: to buy beers and sodas for resale.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate, a 22-year-old married mother of three children, all currently in school, lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past six years, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her small food market.

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy more food for resale. This will help her to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Immaculate hopes that in the future she will be able to own a wholesale enterprise.

Immaculate is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Immaculate's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more food for resale.

loans.name: Omar Hamady

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Omar  Hamady, âgé de 50 ans est marié  et père de huit enfants dont l’ainé a 10 ans et le cadet 2 ans. Il est boulanger de profession et a acquis une expérience de 10 ans dans ce domaine. Parallèlement,  il fait de l’embouche ovine  qu’il a  démarrée  en 2010. Et c’est pour améliorer  et augmenter son cheptel qu’il demande un crédit de 300000 FCFA.
Il  s’occupe de la dépense quotidienne de son foyer  et veille à l’amélioration de leurs conditions de vie. Monsieur  Omar Hamady nourris un grand projet futur : celui d’avoir une ferme et d’y faire que de l’embouche ovine à grande échelle.
texts.en:
Mr. Omar Hamady is a 50-year-old married father of eight children. The eldest is 10 years old, and the youngest is 2. He is a baker by trade and has ten years of experience in this profession. As a sideline, he also started sheep fattening 2010. He is seeking a loan of 300,000 CFAF to increase and improve his livestock. 

He handles the daily household expenses, and strives to improve his family’s living conditions. His great ambition for the future is to have a farm where he would practice sheep fattening on a large scale.

loans.use: to buy livestock for his sheep fattening activity.

loans.name: Sayyora

texts.ru: Сайёра жительница города Истаравшан. Ей 28 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Сайёра занимается торговлей национальных свадебных платьев и тюбетеек. Этим видом деятельности она занимается два года. В торговле эй помогает ее муж. Она берет кредит для покупки платьев и для заказа тюбетеек.
texts.en: Sayyora lives in the city of Istaravshan. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. For two years, Sayyora has been selling traditional wedding dresses and tubeteikas (traditional caps). Her husband helps her with the trade. Sayyora is taking this loan to purchase additional dresses and order new tubeteikas.

loans.use: to purchase dresses and order new tubeteikas (traditional caps) for her shop

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, a 35-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are still in school, lives in Yei, where she has been selling food for five years. Esther, who learned about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer, is now requesting her third loan, this one in the amount of 900 SDG in order to purchase breads. She will use the extra income arising from the loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase breads for sale.

loans.name: Mukhtorjon

texts.ru: Мухторчон более 20 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Ему 64 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Он берет кредит для закупа семян.
texts.en: Mukhtorjon has been cultivating crops for over 20 years. Mainly, he grows vegetables for sale. Mukhtorjon is 64 years old, married, and has two children. He is taking this loan to purchase seeds.

loans.use: to purchase seeds

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 23 years old. He sells bricks to earn a living, he has been in the business for one year and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya he has been able to improve his living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy bricks for resale.

loans.use: To buy bricks for resale

loans.name: Alma Virginia

texts.es:
Alma Virginia tiene 29 años de edad, es casada hace 10 años y su esposo trabaja haciendo trabajos de albañilería y soldadura, tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 3 años de edad de los cuales solo el mayor estudia y vive con su familia en la aldea Tegucigalpita, Omoa, Cortes.
La señora Alma Virginia tiene un negocio de venta de variedades de productos, (juguetes, vasos, biberones etc.) ropa y calzado de mujer. Inicio su negocio con fondos propios con el fin de ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios fue el motivo de establecer este negocio y le ha funcionado muy bien. Trabajando muy duro desde las 9.00 am hasta las 6.00 pm.
Desde que inicio su negocio ha recibido créditos con ODEF teniendo un buen record crediticio y así ha podido surtir más su negocio. Ahora solicita su quinto préstamo de 21,000 lempiras para la compra de útiles escolares (cuadernos, plumas, lápices, uniformes, zapatos), aprovechando la temporada escolar.
Su meta es surtir más su negocio y generar mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Alma Virginia, age 29, has been married for ten years.  Her husband does bricklaying and soldering work.  She has two children, ages eight and three.  The older child goes to school.  She lives with her family in the Tegucigalpita village of Omoa, Cortes.

Alma Virginia has a business selling varieties (toys, glasses, and bibs, etc.), clothes, and women’s shoes.  She started her business with her own funds in order to help her children with their education.  This was her motive for establishing this business, and it has worked well for her.  She works very hard from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.

Ever since she started her business she has received loans from ODEF.  While maintaining a good credit history, she has been able to stock her store more.  She is now requesting her fifth loan for 21,000 lempiras to buy school supplies (notebooks, pens, pencils, uniforms, and shoes).  She will do this to take advantage of the school season.

Her goal is stock her business more and to generate more income.

loans.use: to buy school supplies (notebooks, pens, pencils, uniforms, and school shoes).

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 48 years old and a business lady; she is married to Peter, a business man. They are blessed with three children. She has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past ten years with a monthly income of 8,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET Ltd. after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Lydia will use the loan to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to distribute the greens to the nearby schools and hospitals.

loans.use: to buy green vegetables and fruits for her business

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 19 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala west region of Uganda. For the past two years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her small business, which does stone quarrying. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for the business, and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and pay school fees for herself. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Lydia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Lydia's future prospects by helping her to improve her business that has paid her school fees.

loans.use: to buy more materials for the business

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en:
This is Jacinta, 50, a resident of Tanza, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Celestino, a steel man, and is a mother to her child. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. 

Jacinta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five peso's-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 350 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day. 

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Jacinta hopes her business grows more in the coming year and dreams of being able to give her child a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Bogue

texts.fr:
Bogue est une femme âgée de 33 ans. Elle est mariée å un  revendeur. Elle a 01 enfant de 04ans scolarisé.
Bogue travaille comme couturière et revendeuse de prêt à porter depuis 2007. Elle a un atelier afin de répondre à la demande de la clientèle.
Bogue a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes pour confectionner des habits. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Bogue voudrait agrandir son atelier. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, Elle prévoit d’avoir une famille heureuse.
texts.en:
Bogue is 33 years old and married to a reseller. She has a 4-year-old child who attends school. She has been working as a seamstress and retailer of ready-to-wear apparel since 2007. She works out of a sewing shop to better meet customer demand. 

Bogue is seeking her first loan from WAGES to buy pagnes (colorful West-African cloth) to make outfits. She wants to reinvest in her activity.

In the coming years, Bogue would like to expand her sewing shop. She plans to use the profits to ensure her family’s happiness.

loans.use: to buy pagnes to make outfits.

loans.name: Nighty

texts.en:
Nighty lives in Yei. She is a food-stall seller and has been in business for three years. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children. One of them is still in school. 

Nighty heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer. This is her first loan from BRAC. She has requested a loan of $500 in order to purchase onions and tomatoes. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: to purchase onions and tomatoes for sale

loans.name: Gereltod

texts.en: Gerelt-Od's cafeteria business was changed by the new business such as plumbing service. Now he needs some new plumbing equipment. Because his previous equipments have became old and works badly. The loan he is taking will be used to cover the cost of necessary plumbing equipments for his business.

loans.use: To cover the cost of necessary plumbing equipments for his business.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana tiene 35 años, está casada con Gregorio con quien tiene 5 hijos, pero solo vive con 4 de ellos. Toda esta familia vive en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Clara, distrito de Huasahuasi – Tarma. Hace 20 años que Viviana se dedica a la agricultura. Su vida se centra en el cuidado de sus terrenos, ahí pasa la mayor parte del día. Sus principales cultivos son de papa en sus diferentes variedades. Con el carisma que la caracteriza en la comercialización, vende sus productos en el mercado central de la ciudad de Tarma; gracias a su buena disposición en el momento de la venta. Uno de sus principales problemas es la rancha que afecta sus cultivos, así también otras enfermedades, pero eso no la desanida y para más adelante quiere comprar sus propios terrenos agrícolas y de esa manera minimizar costos de inversión. Sus hijos son su prioridad y destina la mayor parte de sus ingresos en sus estudios. Pero gracias al apoyo de su banco comunal; puede emprender no solo sus proyectos también brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos. Esta vez sembrará 40 sacos de semillas de papas, y para eso deberá invertir en el pago del arriendo de algunos terrenos. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Trabajemos unidos”, y este sería su crédito número 12 con MFP; donde agradece por todo este tiempo que; gracias al apoyo de su asociación. Pudo sembrar.
Viviana; iniciará otra siembra de papas, por eso, con el dinero del préstamo comprará varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos. Además pagará el arriendo de sus terrenos y a los operarios quienes ayudarán en la siembra.
texts.en:
Viviana, age 35, is married to Gregorio.  They have five children, but only four of the children live with them.  The whole family lives in their own house in Sana Clara in the Huasahuasi-Tarma district.

Viviana has been farming for 20 years.  Her life centers around the care of her fields as that is where she spends the greater part of the day.  Her primary crops are different varieties of potatoes.  She is known for her charisma in marketing. She sells her products at the central market in the city of Tarma, thanks to her good disposition while making sales.

One of her main problems is the “rancha” (a type of fungus) that affects her crops.  There are also other diseases, but these do not discourage her.  Later she wants to buy her own fields for farming.  This would minimize her costs.

Her children are her priority, and the greater part of her income is for their education.  Thanks to the support of her communal bank, she can not only take on her projects, but she can also give her children a better quality of life.

This time she will plant 40 sacks of potato seeds.  To do so she will need to pay the rent for the land.

She belongs to the “Trabajemos Unidos” (Let’s Work Together) communal bank.  This will be her 12th loan with MFP, and she is grateful for all of this time.  Thanks to the support of her association she was able to plant.

Viviana will start another potato crop, and she will use the loan to buy organic fertilizer to spread on her crops.  She will also pay to rent the land, and she will pay workers to help with the planting.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizer, rent land, and pay workers.

loans.name: Korto

texts.en:
Korto lives in Jacob Town. She is 20 years old and married with a child, age 4, that is in school and lives at home. Her husband is a social worker. 

For the past 2 years, Korto has been operating a shop in her community where she sells bread, cream, soap and others items. Since she lives in a large community and is the only one who has a shop, she is requesting a loan to purchase more bread, body cream, soap and others items for her business. 

She plans to build a house for her child.

loans.use: to purchase more bread, body cream, soap and others items for her business

loans.name: Tarsisio

texts.en: Tarsisio used the previous loan to buy materials for making baskets. With the income generated, he was able to pay school fees for his children and also provide other basics to the family. He has been dealing in the basket-making business for the last 11 years. His major hardships are high fuel and transportation costs and inadequate capital to meet the high demand. Tarsisio intends to use the loan to pay school fees and buy more materials for his business.

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy more materials for his business.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: Moussa est un jeune chauffeur qui pratique cette activité depuis trois ans.Il lui a fallu auparavant, travailler comme apprenti chauffeur pendant 4 années pour obtenir son permis de conduire.Aujourd'hui il conduit un véhicule de transport interurbain. Les revenus qu'il parvient à obtenir lui permettent de prendre en charge ses propres besoins et de soutenir son père dans la prise en charge des dépenses d'entretien de la famille.Son véhicule étant malheureusement en panne, il sollicite un pret de 400 000f pour acheter un moteur. Son ambition est de développer son activité.
texts.en:
Moussa is a young driver who has been engaged in this activity for three years. He was a driver in training for 4 years prior to obtaining his license. 

He now drives a long distance transportation vehicle. The income earned allows him to support himself and to help his father with the household expenses. 

His vehicle broke down, which is why he is now seeking a loan of 400,000F to buy an engine. His goal is to expand his activity.

loans.use: to buy a replacement engine for his transportation vehicle.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es:
Alida de 24 años convive con Percy con quien tiene 3 hijos: María Fernanda de 5, Edith de 4 y Yamile de 1 año. Toda esta familia vive en una casa propia en la localidad de Patay, distrito de Palca – Tarma.
Alida es una joven madre de carácter fuerte y perseverante, de esa manera puede dedicarse con esmero a la agricultura. Siembra arvejas, maíz, papas, y flores. Las arvejas le brindan buenos ingresos por sus precios estables, mientras que los gladiolos son más rentables por su poca inversión y por su cosecha rápida. “Siembro 2 veces al año y trato que las cosechas coincidan con los meses donde el precio sube”, comenta orgullosa se su pericia.
La producción de papas, maíz y arvejas las vende  en el mercado mayorista de Tarma.
Mientras que los gladiolos los negocio en la ciudad de Lima, ahí sus precios son más altos. Para ello invierte en el servicio de fletes, pero que recupera con sus exitosas ventas.
Con el tiempo espera adquirir un carro de segunda mano, para trasladarse desde su localidad con mayor facilidad y para trasladar sus productos. Este sería su préstamo número 7 que obtendría de MFP, por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Ella pertenece al banco comunal: ”Los Picaflores de Patay”, menciona que el agrada estar rodeada de compañeros responsables y trabajadores.
Invertirá el dinero de su crédito en la compra de semillas de arvejas y bolsas de abonos para esparcirlos tanto para las arvejas como para las flores de gladiolos.
texts.en:
24-year old Alida lives with Percy and their three children: María Fernanda aged 5, Edith aged 4 and Yamile aged 1. They live in their own home located in Patay in Palca District, Tarma. 

Alida is a young mother with a strong and determined character which has enabled her to be a good farmer. She grows peas, maize, potatoes, and flowers. Peas bring in a good income as prices are stable, while gladioli are more profitable as they require very little investment and grow quickly. “I sow seeds twice a year and try to have the harvest coincide with a time when prices are high,” says Alida, proud of her skills.

The potatoes, maize, and peas are sold in Tarma’s wholesale market, whereas the gladioli are sold in Lima where prices are higher.  She pays for them to be transported to Lima but the cost is offset by successful sales. As time passes, she hopes to get a secondhand vehicle to transport the flowers and produce more easily.

This would be Alida’s seventh loan with MFP. She promises to make the monthly repayments punctually. She belongs to The Picaflores de Patay Community Bank and is happy to be surrounded by responsible and hardworking companions. Alida plans to use the loan to buy pea seeds and sacks of manure to spread both on the peas and on the gladioli.

loans.use: to buy pea seeds and sacks of manure

loans.name: Mujeres Adelante (Portoviejo) Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo cada quince días se reúnen los 2 socios y las 17 socias del Banco Comunal Mujeres Adelante, este es un grupo de personas que se dedican a diversas actividades para mejorar su calidad de vida, se dedican al comercio, venta de comida entre otras actividades.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la señora Narcisa, tiene 45 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya mayores de edad y el menor de 10 años que  estudian en escuela. El marido se dedica a la agricultura. 

Ella es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar hace varios años y con lo poco que tenía adecuo un lugar en su casa  y puso una tienda de comestible,  con la cual puede salir adelante ya que su esposo gana muy poco en sus faenas del campo.  Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, su hijo y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando están desocupados, tiene ya diez años con su negocio y gracias a esto ha podido solventar los estudios de sus hijos.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y está muy a gusto con el grupo ya que es un grupo muy responsable.
 
Su meta es seguir adelante en su negocio y que crezca cada día más.   

Las dos fotos pequeñas son de dos socias que por motivos de trabajo no pudieron estar presentes cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 2 men and 17 women who make up the 'Mujeres Adelante' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a group of people who work in different business activities in order to improve their quality of life.  They work in commerce, food sales and other activities.

One of the members of this group is Narcisa.  She is 45 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has four children.  Three of her children are adults and her youngest is 10 years old and in school.  Her husband works in agriculture.

Narcisa is a very good mother and wife.  In order to help her husband with their household expenses she set aside a space in her house several years ago and, using the little money she had, she started a grocery store.  This has enabled her to provide for the family as her husband earns very little from his agricultural work.  Narcisa works every day, from 6.00am to 8.00pm, and sometimes until later.  Her husband and son help her in her work when they have any free time.  She has been in this business for ten years and it has enabled her to pay for her children's education.

Narcisa will use this loan to further stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats and other essentials.  She has been a member of her community bank from the beginning and she is its president.  She is very happy with her group because it is a very responsible group.

Narcisa's goal is to continue in her business and to grow it further.

The two small photos are of two members who, for work reasons, could not be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, cold meats and other essentials

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is a 44-year-old business lady. She is a single mother of two children, ages 23 and 18 years, respectively. Hannah has been selling fruits for the past 3 years, with a monthly income of 5,000 KES which she uses to support her family. 

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Hannah will use the loan to buy fresh fruits for her business. With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. 

Her hopes and dreams are to start a green grocer business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruits for her business

loans.name: Ganbat

texts.en:
Ganbat is a 50-year-old married man who lives with his wife and daughter in an outer ger district, which lacks basic infrastructure, of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

His daughter, Dariimaa, has been working as a head of “Scholarship Education” training center since 2008. Her training center’s mission is to create opportunities and to place students on scholarship programs. The center also manages foreign language training. 

Previously, a Kiva loan was requested by Dariimaa , but now her father, Ganbat, wants to support to his daughter’s business in order to republish her book's third edition again. So Ganbat is requesting 2,500,000 Mongolian Turgriks (MNT) to publish his daughter book about scholarship programs for teenagers. Currently they rent an office building. Furthermore, they want to improve Ganbat’s daughter’s business and to own just their office room.

loans.use: to publish his daughter's book

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely de 33 años, es madre soltera con 2 hijos. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicado en el distrito de Pichari. Nely es una joven que desde muy niña paso muchas dificultades como el abandono de su padre quien lo dejó cuando tenía 7 años. Es así que creció junto a su madre, quien la educo y ahora se dedica al expendio de abarrotes en su tienda.
Cuenta que gracias a su tío quien la apoyo bastante con la finalidad de que su sobrina se dedicase a algo mejor; le dio un pequeño capital para emprender un negocio, fue así que abrió su propia tienda de abarrotes. Al comienzo lo hizo en una tienda alquilada hasta que logró un día construir su propia vivienda, en donde ahora esta ubicado su negocio. 
Nely esta tan contenta con su negocio por que percibe buenos ingresos si sacrificarse tanto, solo tiene que ser amable y vender sus productos a un precio justo. En un futuro Nely esta pensando abrir una tienda de venta de ropa, porque vio una buena oportunidad a este negocio.
