Rhodah's group is comprised of two hardworking women.  Rhodah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  For the past four years, Rhodah has been working hard to manage her salon, which does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Rhodah has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to buy more braids for resale, which will help Rhodah generate greater profits and improve her lifestyle.  Rhodah hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Rhodah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program.  In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training. The ELA program has increased Rhodah's future prospects by helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy products for her Beauty Salon.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 65 years old and the father of six children ages 18, 16, 14, 12, 9 and 6.  He buys and sells cattle, a business he has been doing for four years and earns him a monthly income of KES 6,000. 

He has requested a loan of KES 5,000 to help him start poultry farming.  The profit from his business will help him repay his loan.  George hopes to expand his business and educate his children well.

loans.use: start poultry farming.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходур проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 26 лет. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Сам он занимается торговлей. Он арендует торговую точку на рынке, где занимается торговлей хозяйственных товаров и запчастей мобильных телефонов. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 10 лет. Кредит берет для покупки DVD, батареек, панелей телефонов и розеток.
texts.en: Bahodur lives in the Jilikul region. He is 26 years old, married, and has a child. Bahodur is engaged in trade: he rents space at the market where he sells household goods and spare parts for mobile phones. He has been doing this for 10 years. Bahodur is taking this loan to purchase DVDs, batteries, phone displays, and electrical outlets.

loans.use: to purchase DVDs, batteries, mobile phone parts, and electrical outlets for his shop

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity lives in Yei. She is a charcoal seller, and has been in this business for six years. She is 48 year old, married, and has six children, two of whom are in school. 

Charity heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  She has requested a loan of 500 SDG in order to purchase more charcoal. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.  This is her first loan from BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Vicky

texts.en:
Vicky lives in Yei. She operates a food stall, and has been in this business for four years. She is 40 years old, married, and has six children, two of whom are in school. 

Vicky heard about BRAC South Sudan from a credit officer.  She has requested a loan of 700 SDG in order to purchase beans to sell. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children’s school fees.  This is her second loan from BRAC.

loans.use: to purchase beans for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 39-year-old, Lebanese, divorced man living with his only child, who is still attending school.  He is doing the best he can to offer his child a suitable life and respectable future.  He has been working in construction since 1996 and waiting for the perfect time to grow in the field. Today, he is looking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new construction tools for his business.  This Kiva loan will increase his profits and, thus, his revenues.  In the future, he plans to take on projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase new tools for his construction business.

loans.name: Ngteer Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 24 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 16 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce de détail.

Madame Pauline  qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 37 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge un autre enfant confié par ses parents.

Elle s’active dans la vente de légumes. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.

Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.

Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This solidarity group was created on March 24 2001. It consists of 16 women who live in the same neighborhood. Their main activity is retail sales.

Mrs. Pauline is the head of the group. She is standing on the right in the photo, with her hand raised. She is 37 years old and married with five children. She also takes care of another child entrusted to her by relatives.

Pauline sells vegetables. She has a lot of experience in this business, which she has been practicing for several years.

This loan will enable her to strengthen her working capital and better expand her activities. She will use the profits to improve her family’s living conditions (healthcare, food, clothing, etc.) and to bolster her savings.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for resale.
